description:
i drive over 2 hours to eat at this place.. found it by accident but once i saw the Cheez Whiz cans in the window i knew it was love.. the staff is always awesome and the food is always on point.. 

steak wit whizz, pack the peppers in and make it oink (that means throw some bacon in it please)
author: California B.

description:
Having tried the majority of cheesesteak-centric restaurants in the city, Phillies stands out in a big way. They really hit the nail on the head. Flavors and textures are all on point. There's just nothing I can fault. Treat yourself.

Oh, also, if you're not already a cheesesteak person or you're not sure what to get:

Keep it simple and traditional. Get a cheesesteak with onions and either whiz or american cheese. Don't mess with what works until you've had it.
author: Austin M.

description:
I asked the guy at the counter three times for hot sause I get home and was extremely surprised at the little hot sauce I revived for spending 45.00 dollars there
No ketchup as well HIGHLY disappointed
author: Carlos M.

description: Little joint in our neighborhood - always drove by but never stopped in and we finally did. I don't know why but was surprised how clean the facility was. As soon as you walk in the smell invites you to continue walking in. The staff super friendly and super efficient. The menu choices awesome.  Salads, sandwiches...Husband ordered the BLT and I ordered the Mushroom Philly and it was both delicious. Portions more than adequate. I did not eat the bread, however, if I could I know I would have enjoyed it. It was definitely the perfect philly bread. Highly recommend. Parking is a challenge since it is on Geneva but we were able to find street parking that day near Walgreens!
author: June R.

description: Didn't know this place existed until I accidentally found it on my way to get Popeye's. Grabbed this instead and found my new go-to hole in the wall. They have a great beer selection on top of creative varieties of cheesesteak sandwiches and sides.
author: Usman P.

description:
This place is just down the street from my house. My boyfriend and I have been here twice now - both were stellar experiences! We've been served by the owner, and by one of his staff, Ruben. They both are locals, such nice guys, and they make a damn good Philly. I prefer my fries extra crispy and both times the have accommodated my request perfectly! Great staff, great food. Great beer selection. 

This place is delicious but, caution, it definitely adds up quickly. The sandwiches are between 10-14$ each, fries are 3$, and then the beers are another 5-6$. Both times we've stopped here we have spent about 45-50$ (which is fine, really, considering these sandwiches are big enough for two meals). Definitely would recommend.
author: Taylor D.

description: This is amazing. Great cheesesteaks, great service. Would reccomend to anyone who likes a traditional philly cheesesteak.
author: Jaz Q.

description: Just amazing! Had it once and I've craved one daily ever since. Perfect amount of cheese and meat. The peppers give it its extra punch, and I usually get it without peppers, since most places have soggy peppers. First time I got the pizza phillie, which I wasn't sure about but it was bomb! I got it with the side of cheese fries, which they do with the whiz, but this didn't taste like the ordinary cheez whiz, it was much cheesier and rich. Which let me to needing to try the original phillie with cheez whiz and I was not disappointed at all. Love this place.
author: Melly C.

description:
I ordered this on Postmates on a whim after watching "Creed" and seeing the main characters chow down on chicken cheesesteaks...and I was NOT disappointed.

My sandwich was SO good, if not a bit overly cheesy...but I asked for Cheez Wiz AND provolone, so that's probably overkill.  The bread is excellent and you get tons of meat - very filling.  I love that you can customize your toppings with different peppers.  I went with hot and sweet, and my sandwich was super flavorful.

We also ordered chili cheese tots - tots are definitely the way to go for delivery, because they work better soggy then fries do.  I would say, however, that these were a little too salty for me....and, more importantly, the sandwich is definitely filling enough on its own.

I'll definitely order from here again!
author: Tay H.

description:
I love that there's now another legit spot in SF that raises the bar on the quintessential cheesesteak.

Amoroso rolls, toasted but soft on the inside, they got 'em. Juicy top sirloin steak, chopped and grilled to perfection, yes. You choice of cheese and sweet and hot peppers to top it off, mos def.  

Nothing to pick at, these were some epic cheesesteaks that transplanted me back to the east coast with the first bite.  Only thing I would suggest is to always get extra cheese to balance against the generous portions of steak.  That's the only thing I felt was lacking the first time and since then, it's been perfection with double cheese.
author: Saminda W.

description: Don't place a delivery order. They'll screw up your order and won't answer phone.
author: Jillian J.

description: New to the Bay from NJ and had a taste for a Philly cheesesteak. I saw good reviews so thought why not. Order a Philly cheesesteak with hot peppers on the side and they put them in the sandwich. It was clearly in the notes section and was read back to me over the phone. After contacting Phillies about my sandwich, Ihab specifically said that I was trying to "come up" as if I were lying. It's a cheesesteak dude. All I wanted was for Phillies to pick up their sandwich and send me the correct one. This was not the case. I am extremely disappointed that Phillies would think I was trying to get over on them. That is a total waste of my time and not in my character. Maybe they have dealt with a lot of bad people in the past or were having a bad day, but I will NEVER order from them again. This was my first and last order.
author: Anthony W.

description: This place is on an unassuming street. You walk in and are immediately greeted by the friendly staff. I ordered the peper steak and it was  hot & juicy with the bun being crunchy and soft at the same time. Their cheese fries were heavenly as well. The owner Mo was there and really knows how to treat customers right. I would definitely come back to this place when you want a no-nonsense delicious meal!!
author: Bethmarie R.

description:
I ordered delivery from this place during my one of my hangovers. I was kind of going for a greasy, artery clogging philly cheesesteak that I'm used to in Berkeley, but I read good reviews for this one so I gave it a try.

I've had one philly cheese steak from Philly and I remember it being good and different than the California ones. This sandwich reminded me so much of that. It was so so good and on a long soft bun. I got the "works" with cheese whiz and the sweet peppers and hot peppers on the side (since I wasn't sure if I wanted it inside). I was so wrong. The peppers (both) were amazing and I ended up stuffing them in the sandwich, wishing I had extra. The only thing I wish was that they gave more cheese. Next time I will ask them to double/triple the cheese.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Philly cheesesteak just delicious here. The owner is soooo nice man with customers treated us very well.
author: Qas A.

description: Been to this place plenty of times and it has never failed. Try the chili cheeses fries as well to go with your sandwich. I've tried plenty of other spots in the city but this is the one right here.
author: Jaydah415 ..

description: Pretty darn good.  No complaints but it's hard to impress me with a cheesesteak.  I will keep going back here for sure.
author: Quentin L.

description: I love Phillies i was there when it first opened and there food is amazing just great
author: Lani K.

description: Returning for first time since last review. Wanted to give them a shot. If tonight is indicative of improvements, then I'll be back. All items delicious tonight, notably better than a year ago
author: Kyle S.

description:
There's really only one place I eat cheesesteaks when I'm craving them, and thats the Cheesesteak Shop. So I decide to go on a mission to find the best cheesesteak around. And first on the tour is Phillies. I seen a lot of positive feedback about this joint so I had to go see what it was really about.

I ordered "The Works, Cheesesteak" featuring Cheese Wiz
A happy medium on portion size here. Its not overloaded with meat and all that extra other stuff. Some cheesesteak places I've been too think that if you just throw a pile of meat on the plate, that its a good well done. But thats not always the case. The meat has good flavor, I feel like the meat is more on the premium end. Maybe I'll order more grilled onions next time, but thats just my preference. The cheese wiz is a must! My buddy ordered with provolone and it was just okay. If you wanna get that authentic cheesesteak taste, go with the Wiz! Any other cheese, you'll just be searching for it in the meat. 

On the side we also order garlic fries for $3.95 and tots for $2.95. Solid garlic fries, even though at first sight I was thinking it was gonna suck because of the lack garlic thrown on top. But it had the flavor so I can't complain. The tots were good, just you basic ones. I would probably get the cheese tots next time. The portion size is enough to share for two people so they give you a lot.

The two fella's holding down the restaurant were cool, quick, and friendly. Great cheesesteaks pair with good service. Two Thumbs up!

*** Parking here sucks, careful if your parking in the neighborhood cause its dark.
author: Arron E.

description: Tater tots were flawless. You have to get extra cheese because regular is not enough. But I didn't want to take away from that because the entire meal was amazing!
author: Carlos G.

description: 15$ for a tiny portion fit for maybe a child. The restaurant was relatively empty and the wait for supposedly 3 take outs took over 10 minutes! Never coming back here.
author: L. C.

description:
If you're from Philadelphia, this place is worth a visit.  There are only a handful of places in SF which have authentic cheesesteaks, and this place is one of them.  What makes them authentic?  Amoroso's rolls and Cheez Whiz.

I ordered mine "Whiz wit", which to me has always meant Cheez Whiz and onions.  The cook asked if I wanted peppers, which made me wonder if "wit" in some circles means both onions and peppers.

The neighborhood is not great.

Note to the owners: your soda selection is excellent.  Consider stocking sodas from Philadelphia such as Hires Root Beer, Frank's Black Cherry Wishniak, Hank's, and a birch beer.  Please also consider carrying Tastykakes.  Beers from Philly might be hard to get, but it'd be great if you had them.
author: Lucullus L.

description:
First time trying our this place coz I'm a big fan of Philly cheesesteaks and it was close by.

The shoe-string fries were on point.
The cheesesteak was flavorful. Cheese whiz was edge to edge with every bite.
Topped with pickled red chilli peppers had a good kick to it.
author: Victor Y.

description:
Great cheesesteaks -- 'rocky balboa' is x2 meat x2 cheese is my all time favorite. Only drawback is it is pricy for the neighborhood. They have cheese tots,
Beer on tap
author: John O.

description: Just used Uber Eats to order from here and we got the rocky balboa and tater tots for $24.08.  They were pretty delicious and enough for 2 people to share!  I do wish the cheesesteak had more cheese and tater tots were a bit crispier.
author: Joyce L.

description:
I literally could have just thrown 40 dollars out the window. What the heck did I just pay for?!!!!!

The tater tots were SO INCREDIBLY SALTY I thought they were trying to kill me. The chili? Campbell soup has better chili in can in comparison.  

I've never been so disappointed after reading and seeing all the awesome photos and reviews. I don't know what I got but it looked nothing like photos posted. Nor did it taste anywhere near the price you pay for. 

Now I'm wishing I would have just paid for delivery of a mediocre pizza place. I would have been way happier. :'-( My hard earned cash just down the toilet. Boooo phillies,  shame on you!
author: Ada A.

description: Great food, friendly staff! These cheese steaks are definitely comparable to the east coast.  Outer mission needs more places like this!
author: Nina V.

description: I was pretty bummed when my old favorite cheesesteak disappointed me earlier this month, so when I walked home from work and passed Phillies I was a happy fella! I got a steak with whiz and everything and it was delicious. A little on the pricey side, but delicious sandwich in an expensive city so I won't complain too much. Nice guys, nice place. Will DEFINITELY be back! Thanks!!
author: Julian S.

description:
I was heading back home late Saturday night, and wanted something quick and more on the simple side - by that I mean not spending over $20 because I want everything on the menu. I saw a cheese steak place and figured let's give it a shot!

Located off Geneva and Mission, and dangerously close to Dark Horse Tavern, this hole in the wall cheese steak place is worth stopping in. 

1) It's a good cheese steak. I'm not saying this is the best I've had (I still love you Philly Phlava!) but this might be one of the best in the Bay Area. Solidly grilled meat, good provolone, nice grilled onions, and that mayo. But more importantly...

2) They get Amoroso Rolls. If you know anything about philly cheese steaks, it has to come on an Amoroso Roll. Something about it absorbs the delicious meat juice, cheese, grease, and mayo perfectly. 

3) They do offer cheese whiz for the purists, and it is their best seller. But I'll stick with provolone for the time being.

4) Holy crap do they have a great bottled beer selection and a few on tap. I considered chugging one but as I wasn't too familiar with this part of Outer Mission and all the pedestrian traffic I came across, I'm glad I did not.

5) They do have Saranac's Shirley Temple AKA the Manliest Beverage on Earth! (also just learned Saranac does make beers. Neat.)

So if you are ever craving a solid cheese steak in this part of the City, this is the one I recommend.
author: Michael C.

description: I always go for the buffalo cheesesteak with the cheese wizz and it gets better and better every time!!!!
author: Troy A.

description: I'd rather go to great steak,  a chain food place or resort to a frozen Phillie sandwich rather than this spot. No taste very bland and over priced.  Had to add my own ingredients from home.   -stars if I can give this place.
author: Jeff C.

description: If you're hungry and have the Uber eats app, USE IT! I used the Uber eats app to order a quick 6:00 lunch because I was super hungry. Use my code  eats-uberoynuy  and you will get 15$ off your first meal for your first use of the app! You can also use my code  uberoynuy  for your first time use of Uber for 20$ off your first ride! Continuing on, I ordered the Philly cheese steak (I ate some before I took the picture because it was sooooo good!) And tater tots! (A bag full of paper tots). It was absolutely delicious! Once I took my first bite of the Philly cheese steak with the tater tots, I felt like I was in heaven. The meat with the provolone cheese was absolutely mouthwatering my mouth. I grabbed a cold coke in my refrigerator while eating the cheese steak and tator tots and omg I don't know how to describe it anymore! It was just so good!!! Order it and you will know what I mean! Overall, I will definitely be back soon!
author: Jonathan Z.

description: Amazing Phillies.  Heard the owner was from Gino's in Philly.  Not sure if it's true, but it's soooo delicious I don't care!
author: Susie M.

description:
After living in this hood for 8 years, I'd always wanted to try this nearby joynt, but sadly, never got around to it.

I decided the other day to change that.

I walked down the hill, popped inside and ordered.  The place is super clean and offers a very decent selection of beers by the bottle and a few on tap.

The food arrives and it's good.....not great, but definitely good.  For the best Philly cheese steak sammies, I'll stick with A-Jay's Cheese Steaks in Morgan Hill.  Theirs totally rock and it's a nice motorcycle ride on the back roads of the Santa Cruz mountains to get there.

Good times!
author: Anthony D.

description: Just try it.  This is coming from a fat dude who likes delicious food.  Haha!!  Thank me later
author: Delfin G.

description: Phillies is a great neighborhood place. Everyone should support all our neighborhood businesses. This is a great place for a beer and a sandwich. Support local businesses.
author: Trace B.

description: I have only ordered to go from this place, but amazing!  I love that we have a great Philly cheese steak place in OUR area!  i just get the regular with cheese wiz, and extra jalapenos and pepppers!  It's straight to the point, and so good!
author: Tia Marie M.

description:
I think Phillies is probably the most authentic Cheesesteak in all of San Francisco.  They pretty much cover all the important basics with any real Philly-style Cheesesteak:  Sliced Ribeye Steaks? Check!  Amoroso Rolls?  Check!  Cheez Whiz?  Check!

I had their Mushroom Steak Whiz Wit'out and it was so good!   And the biggest plus here is that they have TOTS!!!  It makes for an awesome combo!

And for those with gastronomical fortitude, they have a crazy food challenge:  5 Rocky Balboas (Large standard Cheesesteak with EXTRA meat and EXTRA Cheese) and 1 soda in 1 hour.  GOOD LUCK!!!

This is definitely the spot if you're craving a really good Cheesesteak!
author: Rodney H.

description:
I just realized you don't need to be on site to write a review! which is great because I love Phillie's but never get a chance to go so far south. I'm originally from PA and must say that this is the best cheese steak I've had on the west coast. proper bread. cheese Whiz. healthy portions. cheese whiz. did I mention the whiz? the only not authentic thing is that they allow you to use other cheeses, which is sacrilege.

whiz it or don't do it at all.
author: Joe H.

description: Amazing sandwiches! They have tater tots!! When i ordered online the delivered! Thanks guys
author: Alec E.

description: Wow!!!!! Very disappointed!!! I use to love this place.  Did they change ownership?  We ordered the beef cheesesteaks and they had no flavor.  The only flavor was from the bell pepper.  They use to have the best french fries and BOY WAS IT A LET DOWN today.  So disappointed.
author: J P.

description:
This is hands down the best cheese-steak you're gonna get in the bay.

It's a hole in the wall, and... you "might" have to deal with "east-coast" hospitality (get over it bitch they are actually friendly). 

My pref, the Mushroom steak, or if I haven't eaten in three days... the Rocky Balboa (seriously, you need an appetite for this one)
author: Paul D.

description: Delicious Philly. The one I ordered was chicken with mushrooms, pepper's and provolone. So freekin good.  Also had a side of tots. Crisp to perfection. With side of WIZZ. Heaven! Bathroom clean ( for customers only), restaurant clean. Service is spot on. I'll be back.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Holy wow. If anybody ever says this place isn't amazing, they are either a liar or simply do not like good ole fashion American goodness.

My favorite spot in SF.

P.S. order the Chase whiz for the Phillies. I like extra personally. Then, when it mixes in with the meat, don't look stupid on front of your friends (or the internet) and go "where's the cheese???"
author: Chris H.

description:
Havent been here for a long time. I had to write another review on my most recent visits. Whenever i do go here, the cashier is always friendly. But i wasn't happy about the service when getting the food. Who waits 15 - 20 minutes for a to go food!! The cooker had a big grill to cook multiple sandwiches (about 6 or more sandwiches) but the cooker only cook one order per person at a time!! I dont know if he wanted to make the sandwiches/meat fresh for each customers. This cost me not want to come back no more. 

I order the mushroom steak sandwich. Cost 7.95. Okay price. They dont cut your sandwich for you if you take it go. It'll get very saggy and wet by the time you get home. I thought it only average/decent. It wasnt as good when i had it couple years ago.
author: Julie N.

description:
First off, let me tell you that I hate myself for not finding this place within the 6 years its been open. Ugh I'm so annoying. 

So on an unsuspecting Tuesday night, me and the guys were hangin out. We have one of those group chats where all we do is talk about nonsense and getting a cheesesteak from this place was a topic for quite some time. I want to say a good 5 days of "When we finna get a cheesesteak tho?"  Needless to say, expectations were pretty high. 

We show up and the place is kinda empty,.... actually it was empty empty. I took a look at the menu and ordered a Rocky Balboa with cheese wiz (I read somewhere on yelp that there is no other way to do it) and some Pizza fries. I decide to watch intently on how they made my sandwich. As I watched, all I could say was "holy chet, that's hella beef and it looks hellllla good" 

As I watched with a watering mouth I got really anxious to tear up this sandwich. I watched as the chef coated the bread with wiz first, then topped all the meat and peppers on top of that and then he put more wiz on the sandwich. They then proceeded to make the fries. Im not sure what they put in their pizza fries but it tasted exactly like pizza pringles. Some of you might think that is gross but them fries was C R A C K I N. Anyways, back to the sandwich.

So we ordered all the food to go. We got back to my friends shop and proceeded to eat. My first reaction to this big ass sandwich was "How the hell do I eat this thing?" Then my second reaction was like "FUGGIT YOLOOOO". The first bite was like heaven. Everything came together just right. The steak was tender and flavorful, the peppers were cooked but not mushy, the wiz was on point and the bread held up! We devoured our food and then proceeded to fall into food coma where we became useless for a good hour.
author: Jimmy U.

description:
Just ordered the mushroom cheesesteak and phillies salad through Ubereats. 

And there's no cheese in the sandwich, we ordered it with swiss cheese... 
The salad has jalapenos instead of sweet pepper and no onions... so just greens and few slices of tomatoes..
The "steak" for both salad and sandwich is unbelievably bland. 

The only thing that is okay is the tater tots, dousing the paper bag in oil...
author: Ari E.

description: Tiny sandwich for $14 (Tapatio bottle for comparison). Didn't even taste good (could get better tasting sandwiches at Subway!).  Total ripoff.
author: josh d.

description:
Absolutely opposite experience than several years ago.  My Mushroom Cheesesteak with Garlic added was delicious, although it could have used more garlic, but that's just me so next time I'll ask for it.  

I have three suggestions that would up my review to the competitions 5 Star.   Just suggestions.  Trying not to be critical or obnoxious:  The garlic appears to be small specks, tiny pieces of white garlic that for me don't add much in the way of flavor.  I think like the competition they should use soft peeled garlic cloves that melt in your mouth with garlic flavor.  The competition's are pre-roasted, however they are real garlic cloves. Also I noticed they took pre-sauteed onions from a metal hot box, reheating them on the grill with the meat.  My 5 Star uses fresh, raw onions on the grill.  They definitely have more snap & flavor. Also I think heating the Amoroso roll on the grill softens it too much, taking away from its 'chewyness,' not that there's such a word!  However like the other place I'm happy Phillies uses Amoroso rolls from Philly.  See pic.  It was delicious, & the mushrooms were fresh, cooked with the steak & very good.  Will be back.  For whatever reason a very different & much better authentic cheesesteak than my last one.  So good glad I ordered a Cheesesteak Hoagie to go!
author: Joshua C.

description: Great fried meat place  :-)  I've gotten cheesesteaks a few times there (which are always good), but didn't go frequently because my spouse and kid aren't into cheesesteaks.  Turns out they also have very good burgers, which they both enjoyed (and the fries are also as good as advertised).  I'm posting a review here, and I'm planning on posting a picture of the half-burger that remains.
author: Rob L.

description: I've never had a philly cheese steak from PA but this is the best philly cheese steak I've ever had. I've been treating myself to a sandwich every week for the past 3 weeks since the first time I've tried it. I've only tried it with Cheese Whiz so I can't comment on how it'll be with some of the other cheeses. What really separates this cheese steak from the others is the bread they use here. The owner informed me that the bread is actually from PA. It has the perfect combination of softness and crunchiness. It really brings the sandwich together.
author: Brian H.

description:
I wasn't going to do a review but I can't stop thinking about how disgusted I am!!
I came here last night with 4 others and we all ordered food and fountain drinks. We all got our drink cups but we opted for the "to-go" cups that come with a lid and a straw so we can take our drinks with us after we ate. Anyway, upon waiting for our food we filled up our cups with the soda of our choice. I opted for water while the rest of my party had soda (my boyfriend got root beer, my niece and her boy friend got the orange soda, and my cousin got the coke). Well by the time we got our food, my boyfriend decides it's time for him to refill his cup. When he took the lid off the top of his cup, THERE WERE ABOUT A DOZEN ANTS CRAWLING ON THE SIDE OF THE CUP! He was so disgusted and started gagging. At first I didn't know what was wrong with him but he showed me and I too was instantaneously disgusted as well as the rest of my party. 
When we went to tell the lady who helped serve us, she immediately got on the phone and called who I assume is the owner. Although she seemed concerned, she didn't apologize right away which I felt was weird. As we started walking out the door, I told my boyfriend who paid for all of our meals that he should get his money back since we didn't finish our food and our throats felt violated and disgusted. He went back in the restaurant and got his money back and it was then when she actually apologized. 
I know it's not her fault. We didn't disrespect her since she simply just works there but we are definitely NEVER going back there. FRICKIN' DISGUSTING!
author: May B.

description: The streets are a bit sketchy so be on alert.... go in for a safe retreat and forget your diet. Cool spot for some comfort food. Good ambiance with unique cool looking leather strap bar stools and probably the game going on in the background. Chill workers perfect spot for hanging a bit after a drink with friends.
author: Stefan T.

description: Been going there for about 4yrs. Seems like they changed ownership. The flavor of the cheesesteak is still good but its really dry now and i got double cheese and piled on ALL the hots and sweets they gave... Still dry. and TINY compared to a couple months ago...
author: Kris K.

description:
I would actually go with a 3.5 stars but thats not an option. A little diamond in the rough and unassuming but solid. I got the loaded cheesesteak with mushrooms and peppers. Loved the peppers, meat was a little
Tough and got cheese whiz. I would go with provolone next time but thats all preference.

Would definitely come back when Im in the area. Rather clean little joint.
author: Brittany E.

description:
I have been craving for a Philly cheesesteak. Debating  either the this spot or cheesesteak shop on divis (which I always love). Since I am around excelsior and haven't been to this spot for 13+ years, I figured I give this spot another try and plus I forgot how my first experience was back then.

Ordered a steak mushroom with cheese whiz. A+ good amount of premium steak. Worth the size for the $ and it was good!

Fries: idk where they get their fries but well seasoned and crispy. Absolutely loved it.

And drum roll...they have beer. Good selections too!! I ordered my lagunitas so I can have my early morning buzz.

Overall -I would recommend this place if you are around the area.

Phillies FTW!
author: Cee M.

description: felt like I was Anthony bourdain in his many shows.  I came across the bay from Oakland pissed off about there is no cheasesteak houses that do things with love and care these guys don't mess around good prices, completely worth the trip I'm telling everyone please mess with them!!!
author: Sean B.

description:
Had a cheese steak. Best part of the steak was the roll. The sandwich was smallish. Had to have two to be satisfied with fries and part of a tater tot order. In Philadelphia, two steaks alone from most South Philly steak places would be more than I could eat.

Taste was about average. 

Fries were OK. Taste reminded me of the fries that Pat's Steaks in South Philly serves. Also had some of my wife's tater tots. These were no better than what I get out of the frozen food section of the grocery. 

My wife considered her cheese fries watered down with diluted cheese whiz. 

Free refills on soft drinks. 

Music videos were playing. 

Prices are reasonable. 

Will not be back.
author: Steven G.

description:
Good solid cheesesteak. Minus one star for giving me beef instead of chix ordered more than once. 

And. Two words. Wiggy Fries. YUM. wasabi grilled onions and...ranch dressing?  Can't remember. Addictive.
author: S Blair P.

description: This place might have the best sandwiches around but please be aware that whatever you put in the special instructions when you order online will be ignored. As someone who has food allergies, I always make a note requesting the offending item be left off my food and yet it arrives with all the toppings. Super annoying and if going into anaphylactic shock wasn't such a bummer, I'd eat it just to sue their asses.
author: ipvcake i.

description: I've been trying a number of cheesesteak places in the city and most have been ok, but Phillies nailed it. From the bread they use (what a sweet soft roll!) to the meat (best grade) to the cheese (they offer Cheez Whiz, which I believe is the core ingredient in a cheesesteak). I got the Rocky Balboa and I couldn't wait to get the champ in my belly. They have a contest for anyone who can eat 5 of them and a soda in an hour, the meal is free, they get their name on a wall, a t-shirt, and bragging rights. In three years, one guy has done it. I can see why. This was ginormous! But perfectly made! I also tried the cheesesteak fries with it which came covered in meat, cheese, fried onions, and sweet & hot peppers. Now this brought me back. I'll be coming back here regularly. Maybe to catch some ball games...
author: Roger M.

description: Tonight was extremely disappointing when we started to drive off and a smell was reeking and our car like old oil I thought perhaps it was outside but when I got home and it tasted to french fries they were horrible they were cooked in old oil. My Philly cheese steak was excellent except the only thing was missing was my mushrooms I ordered a mushroom Philly cheese steak. Staff nice and very professional.  Now I am stuck at home with a bad stomach ache from the bad french fries cooked in old oil. #yucksodisappointed
author: Miss D. O.

description: a friend's house is nearby so i'm glad i found a quick sandwich place. I called in a VEGETARIAN HOAGIE, and it was ready when I got there 15 minutes later to pick it up. i'm not the biggest fan of onions, mushrooms, OR jalepenos.. but somehow they made it all work together! the sandwich is huge, i could have definitely shared with someone - leftovers didn't make it (soggy)
author: Emma G.

description: Phillys has an excellent vibe. The owner Mo is so down to earth and welcoming. My first time I had a Philly Cheesesteak wit' onions, sweet and hot cherry peppers, and cheese wiz. It was incredibly tasty and authentic! The bread itself is from Philadelphia, how rare is that?! You can't find that everywhere. The Philly was fresh, crispy and just right! The angus steak is cut perfectly thin, packed with a succulent taste with the cheese wiz and peppers that accommodate it. It couldn't of been a better experience. Great place for friends or family.
author: Baran Y.

description:
I always get the Philly Cheesesteak with Mozzarella and the Chili Cheese fries are to die for.

I have get to try and compare other philly cheesesteaks out there.
author: Angelica R.

description:
Sandwiches = nom.  Get the real cheesesteak here!  I got mine with Whiz!  (You have two other options, American or Provolone.)

Tater tots = heavenly poppin' into your mouth.

Fries = could use a bit more fry time.

Service = friendly

Drinks = So much beer and craft sodas!!  *glug glug

Prices = reasonable.

Seating = limited.  But we did takeout anyway.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Where was the cheese? Where was the seasoning? Where was the flavor? 

Almost $19 for two sammies and it was a totally lackluster dinner. The cheese melted within the meat into almost nothing. The pickled and caramelized veg did nothing to add in terms of flavor. The bread was plain. Altogether, it was like eating cardboard. . .  So dry and plain! What's the point of going to a shop with a grill when I could have made a better sammies at home on my cook top?

I really wished I got liquid cheese because the sammies needed moisture. 

If you're looking to satisfy a Philly cheesesteak hankering, this is NOT the place. Save your money and go elsewhere.
author: K. S.

description:
This is a true hole in the wall type of place. Very little seating, but that isn't a bit deal since we were only there for a to-go order. Lots of options of cheesesteaks and hoagies! Also, this is the first place I've head of that does chili cheese onion rings. 

My friends all got cheese steaks and I got a side of chili cheese tots. The cheese steaks are a good size with lots of meat on the inside. Very filing and tasty! They use cheese-whiz which I think is pretty silly, but it went pretty well with the food. I asked for provolone, mainly because that's my favorite. 

They also have a large range of different types of beer and sodas. I need to come back and try them all. We got a Dad's red cream soda. I've never even heard of that before! It was okay. I grew to like it.

Overall, I would come back.
author: Jackie d.

description:
So I recently moved back to the area, and ordered twice from here.
However, the flavor is no longer the same. I don't know what, but it's not as good as it used to be 3-4 years ago. At first I thought maybe I don't get the same thing that I used to get, but after the second time, I'm so dissapointed. 
I used to rave to my friends/roommates when we passed this resto about how good the Mushroom Steak. And they all agreed after ordering it.

Last time I remembered, the meat taste different, the Whiz cheese is over powering. It was so bad, I feel like eating a plastic. And no mushroom in my Mushroom Steak. 
Granted the owner can't be found on both occasion when I was there. But still... the taste should consistent right?!
What happen to my fav joint? Please bring back the good stuff. I miss em.
author: Icey M.

description:
It always amazes me and my taste buds when the juice from the meat and the whiz blend together and gets soaked into the roll without making it soggy. Every bite makes you want another bite.

I originally had it 4 stars but I changed it to 5 for their consistency. Every time I hype this place up to someone and take them, they always crave it the next day. and the day after that. and the day after that. 

 I also asked for a food challenge in my last review and they have it. Not sure if I am bold enough to try it, but who knows. 

This is my go to spot. $7 for a sandwich of that size and quality is unbeatable.

Phillies, I salute you.
author: Glenn M.

description: After trying Charley's Grilled Subs the last time at the Westfield... And now finally I get to try Phillies for the 1st time!!! In which, I have been wanting to try their Philly Cheese Steak until today... I ordered myself aTeriyaki Cheesesteak Sandwich for the first time and for me I give it two stars is because my sandwich had very little steak for a price of $7.50 and paid way to much for it!!! If I want a better Cheesesteak sandwich, I would prefer going to Charley's of the Westfield!!!
author: William B.

description: These cheesesteaks are pretty good. The cheesesteak itself is delicious but I gave 3 stars for inconsistency. Sometimes I'll have a nice sized cheesesteak and sometimes I'll have a dinky one with less meat. It seems to have something to do with whether I had pickup or eat in...
author: Jaden M.

description: Had The Works with double American white and onions. It was delicious!!!! Also has an order of the chili cheese fries. I'll be sure to get 2 orders next time. They were that good. I'd def order from them again.
author: Lyda C.

description:
Huge beer selection? Check!
Best Phillies in SF? Check! 
Quick and friendly service? Check!

My favorite is their philly cheese steaks with mushrooms and teriyaki! They have a lot of other options too that are not cheese steaks for those who are not fans.
author: L S.

description: Best Philly Cheesesteak I have ever had! Try it with Cheez Whiz makes a great difference! Tater tots with Cheez Whiz were amazing. Love it! Definitely recommend!
author: Meral K.

description: As Philly native this is the best cheesteaks I've had in California. For those who don't know a genuine cheesesteak is supposed to be cheap, greasy, fatty and delicious. Ruben the cashier/server is a nice guy too. If you're from back east and need the real deal this is the place to go.
author: Anthony R.

description: I love this place! The food is good, the people are nice, the restaurant is always super clean. I love it. I'm so glad they opened up in my neighborhood!
author: Corey F.

description: Phillies seriously takes me back to Philadelphia.  The meat is juicy and perfectly cooked, with extra cheese and jalapeños, my goodness...it's heaven. It almost feels gourmet. The fries are perfectly fried each and every time. The selection of beer is so impressive, makes me want to try every one of them. The owner of Phillies is super cool and welcoming.  You know it's a neighborhood gem when you see regulars ordering their sandwiches without having to look at the menu.  Why would you not want to check this place out!
author: Savinie L.

description: I'm giving Phillies five-stars because it took me right back to Jim's on South Street....their effort is getting closer to the real thing and probably the best I've had in SF.    You can get your provolone with the pizza sauce and all the trimmings, with plenty of Heinz ketchup on tap.  The required Amoroso rolls complete the picture.  Their coated fries are a revelation (and make sure you get them extra crispy)...some of the best fries ever.  Note:  The place looks like a complete dive and I'd give the eat-in ambiance 1.5 stars if I were given that option....but here I'm rating the cheesesteaks (they also have chicken, which turned out to be terrific) and the friendly counter help.
author: David S.

description: I ordered from Ubereats, philly cheese steak have no cheese and the steak was very dry, I ordered garlic fries (fries was good) but they didn't provide any ketchup. Ugh never again
author: Lulu W.

description:
Really, really good cheesesteaks.  So my sister had a brilliant idea (not being sarcastic) to do a self-directed foodie tour of a nearby neighborhood on foot, since there was like a string of eateries up and down the street.  So she wanted to start at Phillies, which she already knew and loved, but wanted to share with me, a San Diegan, not a San Franciscan.  So, here's my past experience with cheesesteaks: someone says, let's get cheesesteaks, my mouth waters even though I'm thinking, oh crap, the calories!, but then because my mouth is watering, I go with the person to get the cheesesteak, eat the cheesesteak, but then feel like a lingering regret for eating the cheesesteak, since it tasted much better in my mind than what I actually had.  (And, yeah, I've never had a real Philly cheesesteak to compare anything to).

Anyway, not wanting to be a killjoy and because I had the automatic salivatory response anyway even after all my past experiences (and because I knew my boyfriend would really want to go), we went to Phillies.  My sister asked them to slice the cheesesteaks into 3 separate pieces (we were on a self-guided food tour, so had to keep room available for other stuff).  We tried the Works, and man, this is the first time I can say that the cheesesteak lived up to what my taste buds imagined a cheesesteak could be and should be.  The meat was just so flavorful and everything else inside of the c.s. was like, complementing it and not overwhelming, all working together to create total cheesesteak yumminess-perfection.

But, anyway...we were attempted to just order more cheesesteaks and stop right there, because we all agreed, it was goood!  but we were on a mission, and we had to complete it...next stop, Batter Up, a corn dog joint right down the street...on we went, despite a strong temptation to just go all out at Phillies.

Really good cheesesteaks! 

(Ambience= extremely casual.  Bathroom extremely small and tight, but clean).
author: Luana H.

description:
It's simple. 
Just like this review shall be.

You can't go wrong with originality or simplicity. 
And Philadelphia Cheesesteaks in SF's Mexican Mission? That's pretty original.

But the thing about originality is that there has to be a kicker. Make something shine to captivate the consumers (i.e. Yelp Foodies all around).

The menu is simple.
You got your Philly Cheesesteaks starting at $6.75, which consists of beef steak, onions, hot/sweet cherry peppers, and your choice of cheese: American, Provolone, or the Whiz. 

Extra Meat: +$2.75
Extra Cheese, Mushrooms, Peppers, or Sauce: +$.75
Add Bacon or Avocado: +$1.00

Pretty simple. And it only gets simpler.

There are also a variety of Cheesesteaks to choose from too, for the lazy and unimaginable (like myself). From the Mushroom Steak, Pizza Steak, or "The Rocky Balboa" (double meat double cheese). Prices range from $7 to $11. 

BUFFALO STEAK $7.50 - 
I was in the mood for some buffalo flavor. Maybe I was craving wings at the moment and Popeye's at the end of the block wouldn't suffice, but I got to ordering the Buffalo Steak with provolone, no extras. 

The Philly consisted of their simple Cheesesteak but with "SPICY buffalo sauce". When my Philly arrived, it looked somewhat disappointing. It wasn't smothered in buffalo sauce or anything (good and bad) but the total amount of actual steak, onions, and peppers looked scarce. However, my Buffalo Steak sandwich itself was quite good. It could have been a lot SPICIER (I love spicy after all) and packed with more everything, but it was simple, made to order, and satisfied my craving. 

I couldn't help but ponder that the only thing that branded my sandwich different than any other Philly on their menu was pretty much the +$.75 for buffalo sauce.. Again, simple if that's how you like to roll.
author: Albert L.

description:
Potential. Near East coast like. Seriously lacking in the cheese though. I had to double check that there even was cheese on it. Defeats the purpose of opening up a cheese steak shop?

A little more beef and a lot more cheese may help this place stay in business, regardless of what they may be thinking (less cheese is saving money? - business doesn't work that way).

Higher quality beef or lower quality would help. Seriously, the thin minute made like beef would fare better than what they have right now. Or go very high quality kobe style and charge more. People will still come. Also, there is something odd about the beef. Like it has a touch of bbq sauce or something? Whatever it is get rid of it. Just meat with salt and pepper is all that is needed. Secret Sauce bs is just that. BS.
author: H K.

description: Not a fancy place,  the philly Cheesesteak is just amazing.  I'm drewling while writing this review.
author: Michael V.

description: I had a philly cheesesteak and it tasted wonderful. These cool dudes were very hard working and chill at the same time. I don't drink beer so that was a bummer I couldn't comment on their great section of alcoholic beverages. Overall, this place is a go to.
author: Vi B.

description:
Love , Love , LOVE this place ! They have really great sides to choose from I highly recommend the chili cheese tots :) 
Pretty good location ( right on Geneva & Mission ) . I usually get the same thing everytime I go ( Teriyaki Cheesesteak ) but I tried the pizza one and it was delicious . Other than a place on Divisadero they are the best place for Philly cheesesteaks in the city .
author: Jemeshia W.

description:
I just love taking advantage of the special(s) and offer(s) that my beloved website allow us to use. Also kinda helps that your buddy has ROTD and given us a suggested place to eat for lunch. 

The sandwich shop has a $10.00 combo special on Thursdays. The combo comprised with a Philly Cheesesteak sandwich, a side order of fries and a fountain soda.  My sandwich had sliced and Grilled Steak with Grilled Onions, Jalapeno Peppers and Cheese-Whiz on a Hoagie-Roll. I've never been to Philadelphia before and I thought the sandwich was as close as the East-Coast treat as it gets. My side order of fries was a nice size portion and very crispy. Free refills on the drinks too. 

The sandwich is very messy. Thus, you'll need a lot of napkins. 

I used my Visa for my lunch. 

Despite being located on the busy Geneva Avenue, this place is very tiny, but clean. Even the lavatory is small, with my co-worker's massive body couldn't get out of the cramped bathroom.
author: Matt G.

description:
I have been to quite a few Philly joints in San Francisco and I have to say this one is by far  the best Philly cheesesteak by far. I have visited this multiple times because I can't get enough of the cheesesteaks. 

I absolutely love every single one of the phillies and I have tried them all at least once. By far, my favorite phillycheese steak at Phillies has I be the buffalo steak. I add ranch into the mix of the buffalo, which isn't on the menu but the mixture of the delicious buffalo sauce and the ranch is AMAZING. Everyone must try it! 

The atmosphere is nice and cozy and you can watch music videos while you sit and eat. 

The employees are always nice and comforting. This place has everything to make me a regular. Absolutely love this place. Everyone MUST give this place a go. 

-Mike
author: Michael S.

description:
Tried the $6.75 "Pepper Steak with Bell Peppers" (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IQN7FHupd698zsc6XmvWQA?userid=09T1oyi6c-9lvyt7gQCD2w), which was filled with meats...they weren't kidding when they said "1/2 pound of meat in every roll" as this thing was huge! The meat was well-cooked without being dry, and there was no oily smell. The peppers were kind of spicy but won't hurt you. Add in an order of $2.50 onion rings (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IQN7FHupd698zsc6XmvWQA?select=9U_zjdlCcaxccw1_7kA_bA) and a $1.50 soda at the fountain (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IQN7FHupd698zsc6XmvWQA?select=dkqJFc0nesHcDa2YVLTvPw) to get a total of $11.67 IIRC.

You can get your sandwich with or without onions, and can substitute chicken instead. This was my first time there and the experience was not bad at all...must return to try other versions of their cheesesteaks. On Thursdays, their special is $10 for a combo meal.

The place has been opened for only four months so it's still clean -  the inside is brightly lit. Located in the middle of a block along a busy section of Geneva Ave (near Mission St), so it's not easy to spot (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IQN7FHupd698zsc6XmvWQA?select=QJOSpEKWe2FXqpziBV3jGQ). Heck, I noticed this place only recently, and I passed by it weekly! Parking can be tough (for meters, a quarter gets you 8 minutes) and the meter maids are always about.

Milestone: the 2500th "Useful" vote's review...
author: Peter L.

description: Pretty good. Can't lie. Gotta pay a little more for the Rocky Balboa but I don't mind it's purrrrty good! Slide thru phillies and try for yourself. IMO it's a pretty good Philly cheesesteak folks!
author: Jaydee S.

description:
I don't think they're exaggerating when they claim there is "1/2 Pound of meat in every roll".

I finally stopped by at this relatively new cheesesteak shop near my neighborhood on Geneva Avenue near Mission Street.  They've been open about three months, and they seem to be doing well business-wise.  The menu is pretty simple with mostly Phillie-type sandwiches and a few sides.  They offer steak or chicken "wit or wit'out onions" and a veggie one cooked on a separate veggie-only grill.  Just like my favorite cheesesteak place in the Mission Phillies imports Amoroso rolls directly from Philadelphia.  At Phillies though, the rolls are toasted on the grill so they have a very nice outer crunch to it.

I ordered a Steak Cheesesteak wit onions, cherry peppers and Provolone.  You can have authentic Kraft Whiz or American cheese as well.  One of my pet peeves is cheesesteak shops that apply the cheese onto the roll instead of onto the meat.  They do that here too.  While it doesn't alter the taste of the sandwich it does make it a bit messier to eat.  Sandwiches are cooked to order so expect a bit of a wait.  I ordered a side of Fries and a fountain soda as well.

While I waited I noticed the Peanut Chews candy bars sitting on the counter.  I bought one of each (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IQN7FHupd698zsc6XmvWQA?select=s3A3k0QFD4iMMAb_YdsT6g) to snack on after the sandwich.  The candies are from the Philadelphia area as well.

The sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IQN7FHupd698zsc6XmvWQA?select=r9TuC71djtOKEMyWy-MAPA) was brought to my table with a generous order of fries (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/IQN7FHupd698zsc6XmvWQA?select=naPNmK52LP5FAaGNeyix6A).  The fries were very good cooked crispy on the outside and nice and meaty on the inside.  The cheesesteak was very good too.  I liked the seasoning very much, but I think without a drink to wash it down with the seasoning was a tad too salty.  I had to eat the sandwich fairly quickly as the grease from the meat slowly began to disintegrate the roll.  Luckily only the tip of my sandwich roll got all greasy.

Friendly staff.  Moderate prices.  Very convenient for me.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Yaum, i like this place's stuffed mushrooms :).

Came here with the bf since it's near CCSF. Just take any bus (29,43,8x) to mission and geneva and it's just walking distance from there. Right across Walgreens really.

We ordered the stuffed mushrooms, mozzerella sticks, and cheese fries. 
They were all very exceptional, although i wish that the cheese fries had a bit more flavor to it.

The workers who were working at the time we came by were absolutely helpful and pretty chill :).

Just a place to try out if youre in the mood for a light snack or sandwich.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
This is one of the dining establishments in the Excelsior/Crocker Amazon with French Fries and Tater Tots on the menu. Phillies Cheesesteaks is awesome and I like my first time experience here so much. I got off the 43 at the bus stop right in front, the Taqueria La Iguana Azul adjacent to this place really caught my attention well. I was very hungry so came in and ordered Cheese Tots which was delicious.

The staff members here are very nice, the restaurant itself is a bit small but the portions for the food were very generous. Also, I noticed this green score card from the Department of Public Health they have posted on the window from the inside. The Inspection Score is 100, so this means the staff who runs this place took the overall cleaniness of the restaurant very seriously.

Here some of the menu items they have:
- Plain French Fries
- Cheese Fries
- Chili Cheese Fries
- Plain Tater Tots
- Cheese Tots
- Chili Cheese Tots

Parking: Mostly Street Metered Parking

I do like that this restaurant is around 10-20 minutes from City College of San Francisco Main Campus.

Public Transit: MUNI Routes 8X Bayshore Express, 8BX Bayshore B Express, 43 Masonic & 54 Felton

Other Nearby MUNI Routes: 14 Mission, 14L Mission Limited, 14X Mission Express & 29 Sunset
author: Bennett W.

description:
I only liked the roll.  I ordered the Pizza Steak with chicken instead, and the Italian.  The Italian had lettuce, unmelted cheese and deli meat.  The Pizza Chicken, had plain, dry chicken, with cheese I couldn't see.

But, the place appeared clean.
author: C. A.

description: Had a pepper steak with ketchup. Sanwhich was large, plenty of veg and steak and it was very good. Had an order of onion rings. Thought the size was a little on the small size but the batter was so delicious I'll order again. This is what a hole in the wall should be. No fuss, not expensive and delicious. Also had a killer beer case.
author: Will D.

description:
I live just a neighborhood away and I don't know why I've never been here until now!

My brother in law bought a sandwich for me but to-go early this year.  It was good but of course, it wasn't great since it got soggy in the wrap.  But, me and my husband randomly decided to get a philly a few weeks ago and we left totally satisfied.

Mushroom steak is a must.  I find that if you add green peppers to your sandwich, it leaves a bitter taste in your mouth.  My husband said he liked my mushroom steak more than his own.  We also ordered cheesy tots which were pretty good but pretty basic--crispy tater tots smothered with cheese wiz.

I love that they serve beer and cider on tap.  Definitely try the Tasty Kakes! We had the chocolate cupcakes--drops bombs on Hostess'!
author: Ivy Z.

description: Wow- I grew up on the real stuff- from one of the two legends at 9th and Passyunk, if you're in the know, you know what I mean. This place is  RIP OFF!!! And they stole the Philly name! Tragically Sad. Sure, they got the Amoroso's rolls and Cheez Wiz but that's where  it ends. Holly SKIMPY on the steak and for $9 again, sad! My hoggie was mostly just cheese. This place would be out of business fast in Philly.......sad excuse.
author: Chris D.

description:
Oh Yelp, why must you delete my reviews?

I tried Phillies and honestly, I just think think it's okay. The store itself is clean and has enough seating for about 10 people, which is great. The customer service is amazing and they really make you feel like you're valued. Unfortunately, the Philly cheesesteak is nothing spectacular and the meat tastes over peppered. I ordered a Philly cheesesteak with cheese whiz and another Philly cheesesteak with provolone and they were just alright to me. For the price, they are a great deal, but I'd rather drive to the city to get a cheesesteak from The Cheesesteak Shop.
author: Joyce E.

description:
Nice people, but I was really disappointed by the taste of the meat on this sandwich.  I thought it basically tasted like freezer-burned steak-umms.

I'll probably give it another shot, but Cheesesteak shop is a much better choice.
author: Rocco B.

description:
First off the rolls, straight from Philly.

Second, steak is well cooked and seasoned.

Third, Cheese Whiz. Doesn't get more authentic than that.

Great place for an authentic cheese steak all the way out here in San Francisco.  If you want a cheese steak, you want to go to Phillies SF. Period.
author: David M.

description:
I love this place! Been driving past it for quite some time and finally decided to stop in and give it a try! I ordered the rocky balboa with wiz and all the fixins. I ordered a side of fried mushrooms and zucchini. 

The sandwich was perfect! Exactly what I expected when I ordered a cheese steak. They really dont skimp on the portions too so you get a meal that is worth every cent! The zuchini and the mushrooms were perfect to go with the cheese steak and a beer.

The employees are always super friendly!!
author: Trevor D.

description:
I'm a regular here. Their sandwiches and steak taste good. Their staff are always good... except today.
I ordered one thing and the lady gave me another thing. I got it, this thing happen all the time and it doesn't matter.
But what happened was she insist that was what I ordered, and said it louder I've heard that you ordered, and still saying when she walked back to where she belong.
Well, I have to say sorry to her that I might order it wrong. But no, I'm a foodie and I know what I ordered, all my friends there heard it too.
I wish next time I go there I'll meet the nice little lady again, not this one.
It is not just about the food, it's the attitude. Very disappointed.
author: Tom P.

description:
Cute spot.  A few pub tables in the back, and beer on tap is good.  I'm partial to Whiz and hot peppers and theirs is just right! 

Fast and Friendly.
author: Ken B.

description:
Super delicious philly. The meat is tender and the toasted roll is sweet and soft. I get the mushroom philly with everything. The hot and sweet peppers definitely round it out for me, but some may think they distract from the luscious meat-bread-cheese combo. 

I'm all about the normal beef philly, but the chicken is pretty good too if you want that.

I've been here a half-dozen times and still think it's awesome, though this last sandwhich seemed a bit smaller in the portions. Still, good enough for me, and I prefer it to the other philly place on Divis.
author: Jay M.

description:
Why does this place only have 61 reviews? This place is located right on Geneva and Mission. Parking is a little rough and there are few seatings and the restroom is small... like really small! But soap and a sensor-towel mechanism offset everything. 

Customer service was great. I ordered the mushroom Philly w/ provolone and Cheez Whiz and though my Philly was awesomely delicious, I think it wasn't cheesy enough! I also ordered onion rings, buffalo wings, and battered mushrooms. Let me just say that I finished everything I ordered w/ no regret that I just woofed down over 3k calories in one sitting. 

I see that they have a breakfast menu!
author: Tram N.

description:
Came back here with a couple of friends after grabbing some cookies. I think the owner was there, but regardless he was really nice!

I got myself the Steak Hoagie with three cheeses, and it was really good! The mixture of cheeses were amazing, but I think it might be better on some other choice cheese steak because the mixes of cheese and toppings made the stuff overflow.

Since I wasn't full last time, I decided to get my cheese steak with fries and at the end I was finishing my fries slowly. I still love the Mushroom Steak though, but I would like to try the other selections as well!
author: Richard C.

description:
Wow, this is the best cheesesteak I ever had.

From the outside this place looks like it belongs somewhere else just because the stores on the block don't look clean. The inside is a whole different story. On a block like this I really didn't know what to expect. 

This place has lots of pride, with all the Philadelphia decorations on the wall and the bright color ORANGE. Pretty neat place and very clean. I looked up to order, the menu was very nice and bright and very organized! The only thing that bothered me were the seats, they only had the high stools, which wasn't a problem because it's all about the food.

I know I would have took a loooong time to order so I just ordered what had the most on it, the Steak Hoagie, with mayo, lettuce and tomatoes. I shouldn't have ordered that because too much other ingredients would have took away from the flavor of the meat just a little, but it was all good because I put 3 different type of cheese on it and it made it even better!! One thing stood out about this was the bread roll. I don't know what it was but it was crunchy and held everything together perfectly.

Definitely a place to go to for a GREAT price for such excellent quality. I'm hitting this place up again and again! I forgot to ask for the little card where you get 10 stamps and you get a free philly, but MAKE SURE YOU DO.
author: Hui L.

description: Yummy!!!! Especially when you have a major hangover. Our friend lives in the neighborhood and when we went to the city for Halloween we came here the morning after, or more like afternoon;-). This hit the spot. I don't eat beef much anymore but when I actually went to Philly and had a cheesesteak at Geno's there I was a beef consumer, so I can't really compare this place to the original cheesesteaks! I had a chickensteak and it was delicious=P. I also had fried zucchinis and they were yummy and fresh. The chicken was greatly marinated too. I would suggest this hole in the wall!
author: Lauren Ashley G.

description:
Very delicious phillies and very convenient location, this place was recommended by a friend and I finally tried it and liked it.
Highly recommend it
author: Adam F.

description:
You-se guys over there! Come here, I tell you why Phillies is the best. (Spits) Phillies like the liberty bell is CRACKIN'! It's rocks like Rocky. It's fly like the Eagles. It's always Sunny and hell Phil's shows brotherly love, champ. This is the biggest thing to come from Philly to out here in the Bay Area since Wilt Chamberlain. 

Formerly 'Starvin' Marvin' this place made it's own place, it's grew into a great place. All about the Benjamins now, baby!!! While it's very successful, it has it's roots in good customer service and great food.

You know you're from Philly, when you can't eat anything without it wrap in a Amoroso Roll. Well, no worries Phillies here in Crocker is the place to be if homesick. Their steaks are 100% top loin. Chicken is 100% breast meat.  1/2 pound of meat in every roll. They import their Amoroso Roll from Philly.  

You can get Steak or Chicken wit or wit-out Onions. (6.50 to 6.75). You can get Pepper Steak with Bell Peppers, Pizza Steak, Steak Hoagie, or Veggie, but IMO, the Cheese Steak with Cheese Whiz and Mushroom Steak are the best!!! 'supposely' veggie are cooked on a seperate grill, but I been here so many times to know that's only half true. Warning: sandwiches are hot like burning hot like the 76ers when they were really hot back in the day. The peppers are hot for another reason, it's spicy!!! AHHHH!!!!! My mouth is burning! Excuse me, I just ate a pepper! 

U can add these sauces to your hoagie for 50 cents: cheese, BBQ, Buffalo, Pizza, Avocado, Mushroom, Peppers. 

Breakfast Philly are serve: egg, steak and cheese for 6.50 and tater tots for 2.50.

Philly Salad: (don't get, be a man and get a cheesesteak, please). 5.99. It's like going to a steak house and ordering salad. Who does that???! WAWA! 

Sides: Fries (2.50). Chilli (3.00) Fried Zucchini Bread (2.50) Breaded Mushroom (2.50) and Soda (1.50).

The best day to go is Thursday as they have a special: Philly, fries, and soda for $10. 

You can dine in, but it's kinda small quarters and the stools are bit wobbly at times. You can watch television while you eat, and near it is the sauce station, and fountain machine. Free refills on fountain drinks. There is candy on the counter, don't remember if it's free or not, never got to ask. Always forgetting to ask.   

Overall: good sandwiches, good customer service, dine in location so-so. 

They do need a couple of things to add to the menu, one day like Scrapple and Wooder ice! Make it made!
author: Ivy V.

description: This place is really good. The cheesesteaks was really good but the it is somewhat pricey. When there with a friend. Order the mushroom cheesesteak with everything on it. My Friend order the original cheesesteak and garlic fries. When we got the order we got serves regular french fries instead of getting garlic fries. Not crazy about the stool setting.
author: Chris Y.

description:
Went here a couple weeks ago. Got the mushroom steak and chilly cheese fries, both did not disappoint. So good.

The service was great. The staff was friendly and quick with my order. They even checked in on me and cousin while we're eating. I would definitely go back.
author: Althea D.

description:
I stopped by Phillies yesterday around 3PM, with no customers or employees in sight. But within a minute, someone came out to take my order. I decided to be simple and just get the regular cheesesteak with provolone cheese, onions, and peppers. The sandwich took about 5 to 7 minutes to make and the seating area was quickly filled with the wonderful aroma of melted cheese and steak while I was watching The Dr. Oz Show on their TV. The bread was a little soggy by the time I got home, but other than that, the sandwich as a whole was delicious! Lots of tender steak and a few slices of peppers to add a little heat. My only disappointment was that it wasn't cheesy enough. Although I'm not a vegetarian, I love the idea that Phillies uses a separate grill for the vegetarian sandwich. The menu is large and in-your-face when you walk in. There's not a lot of seating here, just three round tables and one counter table.

I originally wanted to come on a Thursday to get the $10 combo meal, but I figured I'd save some bucks and just come on any other day for a sandwich alone. I don't need excess greasiness from fries and onion rings or excess sugar from fountain drinks. A solid 4 stars for now, because I haven't eaten a lot of cheesesteaks in the past to compare. But I will definitely be back.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
The Works with Whiz!

The steak was well seasoned, mushrooms/peppers/onions/whiz were just all over the place, and I was pleasantly surprised to find out the bread is actually really soft and yet still  holds up nicely.
author: Harry T.

description:
I loved Phillies ever since they opened and they had tater tots! My favorite is the mushroom and pepper cheesesteak...can't never go wrong! They are adequately priced and are HUGE!

What I like about Phillies is that each time it's freshly made to order! You can enjoy watching the tv while you wait for your order and the staff is always nice + the place is always CLEAN!
author: G H.

description: Great food and awesome beer and Soda selection 50+. Perfect before a game or after work
author: Kevin O.

description: Very pleasantly surprised with how good the food is. I've been to many Philly cheesesteak places in numerous cities and this place is really good. Sandwich was good, garlic fries great, beer selection even better. Lots of flavor and plenty of meat on the sandwich.
author: Susie K.

description:
I really, really, really wanted to like this place. 

I wanted to come ever since it opened. I had to drop my cousin off at Balboa Bart so we came here for dinner since it was on the way. 

The two employees were outside and followed us inside when they saw us enter. I ordered the veggie with avocado and provolone. I also got onion rings. My cousin ordered the mushroom steak and she didn't know what kind of cheese she wanted. She said American but then the cashier said cheese whiz was the best so she got that instead. 

The cashier is pretty charming. All the other customers that came in either knew him, or he is just really good at hamming it up with them. 

Pros:
- The food came out crazy hot. My cousin and I both burnt our hands half way through eating. This is a con for us but I know most people like their food piping hot. 
- Nice service 
- Vegetarian option thats even cooked on a separate grill 
- Pretty awesome Thursday deal, too bad we came on a Tuesday
- Audible tv ( I hate when the tv isn't audible and there aren't any subtitltes. whats the point?)
- Open kitchen
- My cousin really liked her mushroom steak sandwich. 
- Fresh Roll 
- Extremely clean and well lit inside 

Cons
- Food took FOREVER to come out
- Onion rings are frozen. 
- Onion rings tasted sweet. Really strange. The only time I've had sweet onion rings were at Sonics and I didn't really like them.
- I saw that their fries were frozen too 
- My sandwich didn't have much flavor, even after adding a packet of pepper. 
- I read that someones sandwich got all soggy with grease from the meat but I figured it wouldn't happen to mine since I didn't have meat. It totally did get soggy though.
- Not enough cheese. 
- Avocado was brown

I think if you just stick with the meats and add extra cheese, you'll be fine.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Amazing stuff, went twice before actually writing up the review to make sure. 
Simple menu so it wont be hectic 
Great tasting foods
Decently priced
Quaint little Place
Got "The Work" with everything on it just amazing!
author: Gordon H.

description:
A good cheesesteak place.  Philly style, and a basic menu.
The sides in cheesteak places are usually hit and miss, and that's exactly what happened to me at Phillies.

The fried mushrooms were a hit, but the chilli was a big let down, canned perhaps?

The "portablella / veggie" sandwich was also a big miss, with barely any portabella I was pretty bummed out when we opened that one.  It was mostly peppers and onions.

The steaks were decent, although it seemed like the grill wasn't hot enough as the steak came out mostly grey, with a nice hot grill for steak you usually get some crispy parts.  Cooking it grey that way tends to steam the steak making it boil a bit.  

The choice of cheese type was nice, and the dudes at the store were very friendly.

All in all a decent cheesesteak place in the notoriously bad sandwich capitol of the world, California.   They are at least trying to get it right here, and we appreciate it.
author: Nellie N.

description:
Let me keep this short and simple. I haven't had a Philly cheesesteak before in my life, but based on the reviews on Yelp, I decided to make this the first place I would have one at, since I was visiting SF for the weekend. I didn't regret it. The sandwich melted in my mouth, it was excitingly spicy (Buffalo variation), and I've been craving another one ever since. Cheese fries, also as good as expected. Cheap, but only in price, as the place was clean, had some big TVs to keep you occupied, and very friendly staff. Don't be afraid if you don't see a lot of people in, my friend and I were the only patrons when we arrived at 6:30pm on a Sunday, but that didn't put us off, and I'm very glad it didn't.

Looking forward to visiting again, and trying out a different variation this time around.
author: Eleftherios A.

description: This place is the bomb...  Would recommend the rocky balboa if you like it meaty.  This place reminds me of South Phillies on Columbus back in my high school days.  Staff are really nice and be sure to order some Wiggy fries or some chili cheese tots while you are at it.
author: Leon L.

description:
I live around here, and I usually just ignore many of the shops in my neighborhood. But I was looking through yelp and discovered all the high ratings, so I decided to give this place a try.

I ordered the mushroom steak, and sadly, I didn't see what all the hype was about. It didn't taste THAT great to me, maybe because of the high expectations after reading all the reviews from yelp. Overall, the taste was just average, nothing special. I've tasted better philly cheese steaks in mall food courts.
author: Harriet W.

description:
I've just been introduced to the world of cheesesteaks. I'm normally not a beef eater so I never really had much of an inkling to try one.  Well now I'm hooked.

I always order the Mushroom steak with cheese whiz and holy cowl is it huge! The philly is just overflowing with meat and all the other goodness in it.  The meat is full of flavor that even a person who doesn't always care for beef will enjoy it immensely. I always get the peppers added to mine because it  gives the cheesesteak that extra bite to really enhance the flavor. 

My husband always orders the Peppersteak Philly with onions and peppers added. This time he added the buffalo sauce. The added sauce really made this philly "pop". So delicious. (Yep of course i had a bite)

Cheese whiz fries are a must! Nothing better to have piping hot french fries drenched in cheese whiz to accompany my cheesesteak. Next up to try is their chil cheese fries.

I've also had the fried mushrooms and zuchinni. Both are delicious but now I"m hooked on the zucchini. It's so crunchy and full of flaovr and the sauce goes well with it. 

It's a nice clean restaurant. Owner is friendly and makes you feel welcomed. Definitely a nice addition to this area. 

I love that this is so close to my home so that when i get that hankering for a cheesesteak I can just hop in my car and head over.  

I'll post pix of our cheese steaks shortly.
author: Jenniffer T.

description:
Sandwiches are one of my favorite foods.

Big meaty, cheesy sandwiches with caramelized onions. Sandwiches bigger than my face. All I can say is YES.

Protip: You get a ton more onion rings if you order in than if you order take out. Thank me later.

The girl that works the register is always really friendly and helpful. And the interior is always nice and clean.
author: Cindy L.

description: This is the best place to get a cheesesteak in SF or surrounding areas that I've found, and I'm always looking. I used to live in Philly so I always compare what I find to what I had there and these are the closest I've found. Highly recommended!
author: Brian S.

description: This place has the best cheesesteaks in SF, hands down. Also their cheese fries, cheese tots, and especially cheese rings deserve a mention. Also they are open to a decent hour, service is quick considering they cook from scratch every order, and they have a decent selection not only of beer, but of non-alcoholic sodas.
author: hep s.

description: Wow, really good.  Hard to find right across from walgreens and little caesars.
author: Myrone B.

description: 3.5 stars. This place is pretty good. They sell cheesesteaks, and they're close to home. It definitely isnt the best cheesesteak Ive had, but it satisfies the craving. if you live in the neighborhood and are craving a cheesesteak, I dont think it'll disappoint you. check them out.
author: Lisa N.

description:
Probably the best philly cheese Ive had in a while.

All sandwiches are 10 inches and at $6.75 for the original, its a decent value. 

The sandwich was decently juicy and greasy and not too dry. I wish they added more onions and cheese though to make the filling more gooey but the sandwich was delicious. The bread was decent as it tasted slightly toasted and not too soft or hard. The cherry peppers added a little kick. We also got the fries which were decent and big enough to share with 2-3 people. 

Overall, I would come back if I was craving philly cheese as its slightly better than the cheese steak shop. I wish they had curly fries though.
author: Robert Y.

description: This place was wack. I will never eat here again. The meat was dry and burnt. They don't put enough provolone cheese or onions. Never I mean never again will I step foot in this joint. I'm going to stay with a family favorite my good ol The Philly Cheese Steak  Shop on Davisidero. -Dez
author: Dezarae R.

description: Tried this place for the first time tonight by walking and exploring the area. At first my girlfriend  and I where skeptical because of the area, however, due to the lack of options, we decided to try it out. Service was excellent as we were greeted within a minute of walking through the doors and the gentleman taking the order was very knowledgeable about the large beer selection they had on hand. The food was great, the buns were fresh and soft and the sides are made to order. The only thing that could be better is for this business to have a womens restroom instead of a unisex one shared with men. I will definetly be back!
author: AVERY R.

description:
Really fast service, not. Still waiting...been waiting, only 4 sandwiches. 


UPDATE: Got food poisoning from this damn place. Never again! =)
author: mike f.

description:
Cheese wiz??? Man.. talk about amazing!

I been here several times, and I am never disappointed. I love my philly with cheese wiz EVERYTIME (with mushrooms)!  It is freshly made to order. The staff welcomes everyone who comes in. You can eat inside and watch tv.  Everytime I try a philly cheesesteak somewhere else... it is not the same.  I always end up coming back here for more.  

There are plenty of sides to go with your sandwich.  I love the fried cucumber. But the sandwich can fill you up in a instant.  FYI, its pretty good after a hard night of drinking.
author: Cel A.

description: Fast,  cheap, and delicious! Definitely fulfills my cheesesteak craving. You definitely get your money's worth for what you get.
author: Lindsey V.

description: Mmmmmmmmm. Delicious cheesesteaks with ok prices LOL. Prices would be justified if they served fries or some side with the sandwiches. But overall a great place to eat at. Delicious jalapenos that they put on these. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Clean place too. Stop by if you can! Good portions.
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
By far the best Philly cheese steak I've had in the Bay Area!  Bread imported from Philly was warm, soft and the right amount of sweetness filled with the deliciousness that is grilled steak and onions topped with provolone.

This was definitely worth the extra workout I will have to do after consuming this yummy goodness of a sandwich.
author: Aura J.

description: solid phillies of all kinds, decent taste for $10 and fresh ingredients. nothing too greasy. $8-10 for approx 9 inch sandwich. 10 min wait. friendly people. never a line. they take credit. my new place to stop by on the way to the bank on the corner.
author: Anna S.

description: Had a chicken cheesesteak with everything from here today. The order was placed through our office account with waiter.com. Got food poisoning, and have barfed twice tonight. It was the only thing I've eaten today that could have given me food poisoning. I don't like leaving bad reviews but when this kind of thing happens, people should know.
author: Olyn L.

description: I've scrolled past this joint on my yelp list tons of times during my daily quests for the next best lunch spot and today finally decided to try it out. They have like 6 or 8 diff sandwiches basically just all standard phillies but like with pizza sauce, buffalo sauce, with or without mushrooms, peppers etc. there's one option to get extra meat an cheese and I don't think it comes with peppers or muh rooms but it's like almost $12 which is quite a bit pricier than the others which are in the $7 range. The one that comes with everything is pretty good, my husband got the mushroom one and he liked that one just fine. We got a sode of onion rings which were great, exactly what you'd want in an onion ring. BUT the problem with everything is that it's really skimpy.
