Our sandwiches were mostly bread and even tho there was barely anything inside the sandwich, only about 20% of that barely anything was meat. I'd eager a guess that they use about 2 ounces of meat in each sandwich. Same thing goes for the rings, an order had about 4 small and 2 large rings in it. Overall it was tasty food and we spent $22 on lunch for 2 but if we had opted to leave full we'd have spent $40. Prob won't return except maybe if I'm craving some onion rings.
author: Emma H.

description: The phillies and everything else is all good. I only heard about this place because; of my mom she put me on to this place a while back because she knows the owner. He's a cool guy.
author: Relly P.

description:
UPDATE 4/20/11:

Today may go down in history as the day of the spiciest Philly I have ever eaten.  I will call it "The Day of My Spiciest Philly" day.  A purveyor of chilis and spices alike, I was anticipating the next creation from the Chef.  Today it was the BUFFALO STEAK. Now mind you, I enjoy the tear inducing effects of the hot stuffs and have nary a problem delecting on the spiciest of the spicy so my description may be a bit skewed to left(the left side being the spicier of the right and left sides). Unlike the Banh Mi', which when bitten into at strategic locations can give bursts of gunfire-like heat, the Buffalo Steak and the deep relish it is concocted in engulfs the eater's tender mouth lining with napalm-like coverage. Not to say it is the spiciest thing I have ever eaten, not by a longshot but for a Philly and with the constant refueling of the fire with the aforementioned nectar of Buffalo is what made it biteful. The loud flavor was neutralized modestly with a liberal helping of the Whiz, only to have the flavors flip again with a strong finish from the peppers.  You can always count on the meat being consistent so nothing more to say other than, d-lish-amundo. 

My hands and face were covered with the sauce and cheese gravy.  I looked in the mirror and smiled. Yet another creation that  has satiated the spicy needs of The Food Ninja.
author: Fifteen F.

description:
Full article: http://triplexbexx2.wordpress.com/2010/12/02/phillies-cheesesteaks/

Location: Phillies, opened its doors eleven months ago, located on 932 Geneva Ave in the Crocker Amazon neighborhood, across the street from Popeyes between Mission and London street.

Menu: Their steaks are 100% top loin, half pound of meat in every Amoroso roll.  Toasted Amoroso roll, with the options of Whiz, American or Provolone, grilled onions and sweet peppers. All extra sides are $0.50 extra

We had the following:

breaded mushrooms @ $2.50

Cheesesteaks - with extra Whiz, American, grilled onions and sweet peppers @ $6.50

Mushroom Steak - extra Whiz, grilled onions, peppers and mushrooms @ $6.75

Verdict: This place is definitely a competition for The Cheese Steak Shop on Divisadero. Their cheesesteaks are juicy and damn good. Bonus.... they toast their Amoroso rolls, loaded with meat, and it's an absolute must with the Whiz!
author: Rebecca L.

description:
I finally stepped into their doors. Very friendly staff, clean small place...bathroom - not impressed.

I got the buffalo steak - yum! Spicy and flavorful.  I also got a bowl of chili - not a wow but it was okay.

Great option!
author: Pam S.

description:
Been meaning to try this place for the longest time.  When my car broke down on the freeway and barely made it to Geneva on Wed, I finally had my chance.  Lately, I've been the king of making the best of a bad situation so I figured I'd might as well hit their bathroom and have a good lunch before calling a tow truck.

As I walked in, the girl working the counter and the guy cooking in the back were really nice and greeted me.  The menu board was easy to understand and prices looked reasonable.  I ordered some fries and a cheesesteak with provolone, peppers, and onions...no whiz.

I am happy to say that it was really good!  The meat of the cheesesteak was nicely seasoned and had good flavor.  I actually liked the taste of the meat (menu says top loin) at Phillies way better than the meat at Jake's which lately seems bland and underseasoned.  If Phillies increased the amount of meat to the level of Jakes, I would say hands down that Phillies has the ultimate cheesesteak in SF.  It would be so killer!  Regardless, I enjoyed it a lot and I can honestly say that it is definitely one of the best in SF.  My thought is raise your prices if you have to, but make it with too much meat and this thing would be legendary!

The fries were cooked perfectly too.  Nothing fancy, but hot, golden goodness.  I left full, happy, and prepared for the tow and whatever the day might throw my way.  As it turned out, I never did make it to work that day.
author: Roy N.

description:
BETTER THAN GENOS! as good as pats! 

gotta love the mushroom steak wit wiz! they even have tasty kakes to make every east coaster feel at home! their fries are awesome and they even have tater tots! if i was a dog id be wagging my tail every time i walk by. plus the girls working the counter are cute as they come. they even cater to veggies on a separate grill which i thought was very nice. the only thing i could recommend is get some hot peppers! maybe some hot Italian cherries the peppers there are a bit on the mild side. i need to sweat!
author: Matt F.

description:
Phillies is my newest indulgence when I need great comfort food :)
The guys & girl there are cool, down-to-earth, and helpful with suggestions to us newbies. I've so far had the teriyaki steak sandwich, the veggie,(portobello mushrooms) and both were amazing.

It's a small hole in the wall place.  I've lived in the neighborhood for 4 years now and never noticed it!  But the steak sandwiches are awesome!  And the breaded mushrooms, tater tots & chilli cheese tots are mouthwatering! They've got 2 TV's so you can watch the game. Low key.  Chill atmosphere. LOVE it!!
author: Elena P.

description: MMMM Cheez Wiz goodness.  I didn't think I would like Cheez Wiz.  In fact I don't think it's real cheese but when I had one bite of a Phillies with Cheez Wiz I was converted!  You can choose other cheeses like White American but if you've never tried Cheez Wiz I suggest you give it a go.  Try the cheese steak fries for a real treat.
author: Tina B.

description:
Phillies makes a cheesesteak that is tasty, big, and juicy. Most importanly juicy because all that meat juice + cheese drips out of your sandwich in this messy but damn good kinda way. However, no worries about the dripping because there's definitely plenty of meat juice + cheese packed into your sandwich. I tried the steak hoagie + whiz & a mushroom steak + whiz. Both were very yummy. The mushroom steak was a bit monotone in flavor for me because of the meaty steak combined with the meaty mushrooms but it was definitely meat-tastic. At Phillies, when you add onions to your sandwich, instead of slightly sauteing the onions, they cook them with the meat so that it absorbs all the of that meat flavor and becomes super flavorful and soft. But really, it is the flavorful, tender meat and the wet, salty cheese that makes these cheesesteaks amazing. The rolls definitely play their part as they are soft and keep your sandwich together. I also ordered onions rings which weren't super greasy, had thick rings of onion, and were nicely battered.  An order doesn't come with that many rings though.

Service is good and they jump to cook up your order as soon as you place it. Ya gotta love the more than reasonable prices of the cheesesteaks especially considering their huge size! 

On a sad note, romaine was the type of lettuce added to my cheesesteak which gave it a different taste than usual iceberg lettuce does. After having romaine lettuce on my cheesesteak, I think I much rather prefer iceberg. Also, I was asked if I wanted peppers on my cheesesteak and although I said yes, they forgot to add em. Regardless, do yourself a favor and grab a cheesesteak here. They even have a breakfast cheesesteak and tator tots!
author: Maya S.

description:
Went here for the firt time today with my 12yr old daughter and We Both Loved it. Totally better than any other cheesesteak place I've been to in San Francisco. We will definitely make this Our cheesesteak place from now on.. 
They were full of meat, flavor & cheese. Plus, the buns were perfect!!
author: Ayana K.

description: For cheesesteak lovers, phillies is a great place to go. I ordered a Rocky Balboa mushroom steak wit whiz! It was huge and loaded! The meat is tender and juicy and combined with the amoroso roll makes it even better! The bread is 50% of what makes a great sandwich! Also had cheesy tater tots! I will be coming back for more rocky balboas!
author: Roger P.

description:
Ok so normally I go out on a night mission to hunt for food but seeing that my mind was on a mission to find to locate something fast and satisfying cause I didn't want to go for pizza or burritos I decided to come to this place. I swear, I went to this place twice in a row in one week cause I couldn't help but have the sandwich on my mind. 

What to expect / what I got?:

Rocky Balboa - its everything... yes everything
Buffalo Philly - spicy, only if you ppl are into that stuff
Onion Rings - Crispy onion O's its my fav. The alternative to steak fries.

Ok so I hopped in one night and I decided to order and I went for their signature sandwich. Its a good thing that I go in sometimes at night cause its fairly busy. I didn't expect the place to be open but to my surprise since there's very little people that there wouldn't be a hold up on my dinner.  Along with that they have an assortment of cheeses that you can ask for to top your philly (American, Swiss, Provalone, Cheese Whiz). Next time I should Get mine with Cheese Whiz.. They do offer a nice assortment of extras and if you don't prefer beef there is always chicken. They also have an assortment of independent IPA's by the bottle. Some beer and there's a two tv's inside so if you guys & gals like watching sports or the Giant's game on the tele and love philly sandwiches. Your best bet is to dive in here and take some time to enjoy your meal. Another thing I would prefer.. hopefully the O rings aren't pre made but... if they had the beer batter taste it would make me feel alot better that way I don't feel so heavy after eating my sandwich.

There's also some buzz about being their top eating champ in the area. The contest is to stuff 5x Rocky Balboa's and 1 soda within an hour. I'm tempted to try... but I think I'm lacking in certain departments. However, I do plan on asking them to add cream cheese and probably kimchi to their suggested menu items to make a sandwich. I asked about it the evening that I did go in and the gal mentioned that there was a guy that stopped on his 4th Rocky... hrm I'm really up for a challenge and I think even for my size my stomach can handle eating alot of things. 

Anyways, my mission is complete!!! I hope you guys like this review and good hunting to all!!
author: Xeirhen V.

description: Wasn't the sandwich place we wanted to go initially but was a good backup. I give it a 4 because its not too pricey and the Philly cheese steak wasn't too bad. It was actually pretty good. Definitely get your sandwich with mushrooms  it adds a bit of flavor and different texture. The sides are extremely cheap as well. I recommend the onion rings. Best I've had in a while. The bathroom is hella small. But it's all good. When you order they bring the food to you which is pretty cool.
author: Nathan Q.

description:
Was in the neighborhood one night and the place seemed pretty popping according to Yelp. Well, I haven't been disappointed too many times by Yelp so decided to give it a try.

Ordered the regular Phillies cheesesteak (~7) and I'd have to say, it was pretty damn good on a cold and chilly night. I can still taste it now...sweet sweet onions and bell peppers...soft, warm bread...wish the steak was not as dry though! But all in all, it was a good experience...quick bite...quick eat...stomach satisfied. Thank you Phillies!
author: David W.

description:
Ahhh! These guys are so amazing! I put in my last review that I wanted some Flyer's representation, and they totally fulfilled my wish!

I'm so excited because my boyfriend just moved a few blocks away. This place is comfortable, casual, inexpensive, filling, and MINDBLOWINGLY DELICIOUS. I plan to get incredibly fat off the Chili-Cheese Tater Tots.

Phillies is one of the most heart and tummy-warming eateries SF has to offer.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Yes, they import their rolls!  Provolone is layered on the bottom, then comes the meat and peppers.  If you don't like hot peppers then fall back to another type of sandwich.  Or get more fries and tots!

As much as I liked the steak, and the tots, I was really bothered that the woman at the cash register didn't know much about Philadelphia sports. Ok, maybe too bothered. Maybe I'm still pissed that the Phils lost in the playoffs.  But the owners have posted signs about Philly teams around the restaurant, so let's not pretend that they aren't worth caring about or respecting.
author: Mike H.

description:
I like this place more than Phat Philly or The Cheese Steak Shop....I think it's the bread that makes it better. It comes toasted here but its still nice and soft. It's a bit surprising since I believe that they ship the Amaroso rolls from Philly. Don't get me wrong...I think all three places are great, but Phillies does it slightly better.

I recommend getting both the hot/sweet peppers and the mushrooms. I've had it once with provolone and once with cheese Whiz....I actually liked the provolone slightly better. Maybe you can get the best of both worlds and ask for half provolone and have whiz? I'll have to ask next time.

I'm definitely coming back again and will probably try the hoagie.
author: Lester W.

description:
Okay here goes!

I have been meaning to try this place for a while now. So I called in my order silly me didn't have a menu just know what I like. The young lady that picked up the phone was very nice she took my order without hesitation.  
So I arrive, it's lunchtime the strong aroma of onions hit me before I stepped in the door there are only two people inside.  The grill is going, the cook is sweating and the nice young lady greets me at the register, she calls out my name (I'm impressed) Do I look like a Stacey NAH Couldn't be!  So in about 5 minutes I'm walking out the door with a white bag that is beginning to show signs of leakage.  I get excited (Must be what the Fresh-Prince has always talked about). 
So I get in my car and head back to the office. 

I go back to my office and open my bag and Wah-LA! The most delectable Fries one could taste YUM YUM YUM! So I eat a few of those before I unwrap my Steak ---- first the sheet of paper then the foil All while dabbing with paper-towels. Then I take that first bite of My (Mushroom Phillie) Good! and then I take another bite little dry! And this continues throughout my experience with this delectable sandwich. Next time I will get the Whiz and then if that doesn't work then I will get the Mayo. But overall I will be back.
author: Stacey R.

description:
Amazing philly cheese steaks!!! my roommates and I frequent this place about once a week. There are some other places in the city that offer cheese steaks but none as good as this place, I mean come on the meat is juicy and tender, plus it is sandwiched between bread, cheese, meat, then cheese again. Also you cant have this sandwich with anything else but whiz. 

Heres a tip get a mushroom cheese steak wit whiz and everything on it plus some tots, and you will not be disappointed.
author: Luigi B.

description:
A good, solid Steak outside of Philly. I went to college in Philadelphia and had my share of Steaks and I can say that this one is a match for any I ate there. 

I must advise I was never the biggest fan of the traditional steak, as I need some roughage and tomatoes to balance the grease, but I like that it at least tasted good.


So you can forget traveling and waiting in the long lines at Pat's and Geno's - you can get a good one here. They even get the bread from Philly, apparently. 

For some respect points, order like this: "Steak. Whiz. Wit (or Witout)."
author: Ryan V.

description:
the small business strip along geneva between mission and paris is a bit... random. a lonely laundromat, a tobacco shop, a cabinet store, an empty cafe, an abandoned filipino restaurant, a shoe repair shop. let's just say, as long as i've been walking to/from home everyday on that strip for the last year, i haven't had the urge to venture into the places here. which is probably why i never tried going into phillies. 

so i went on yelp tonight looking for a pizza spot in the hood. though there were a few 4.5-star joints, nothing really popped out at me. then i noticed phillies on the list (probably because one of their subs has pizza sauce in it?). anyways, i clicked the link out of curiosity, saw people's testimonials, and decided to ditch the pizza idea, brave the cold outside and give phillies a shot.

small, yet clean and friendly place. went for the pepper steak sandwich with onions and american cheese. it was already almost 9pm so the wait wasn't too long. added an order of fries to my order, and 5 minutes later i was walking home with some goodness in a paper bag. 

i'm not an expert on the nuances of philly cheesesteaks, but dammit this was a damn good sandwich. the meat and fixins were juicy but didn't totally soak up the bread. oh and the bread... nice and soft, but strong enough to cradle the weight of all that nom nom. yes, nom nom indeed.

needless to say, i found me another can't-lose spot near the crib. can't wait to try the other sandwiches! but for now, thanks for saving my lonely friday nite phillies!!!
author: Jack D.

description:
I work around this area and never been at this place. It just happens i checked on Yelp for some sandwhiches. I read some of the reviews about their sandwiches and got good reviews on their Phillycheesteak. Good thing fellow yelpers mentioned about the "whiz" which i guess in short for cheese whiz. 

Ordered the sandwhich with onions, peppers and "whiz" ( felt like ive been at this place before). And it didnt dissappoint. The steak was not dry and even the sandwhich was dripping but still hella good!!!
author: roderick s.

description:
Phillies is AWESOME! Best Philly Cheese steak in SF. Well I also like Phat Philly as well, so its hard to say which one is better. But this is REALLY GOOD.

I came to Phillies today for lunch. i had a regular cheese steak with the whiz cheese (It was different and the guy recommended it, so its all good) I onions and peppers on it, I also ordered onion rings and a drink. Total was $11.50. Not to shabby for lunch. The cheese steak sandwich was AWESOME. I loved it, wanted to get another one but I was super full. The onion rings and fries were frozen. Well they were cooked when I ate them but they weren't good. I just wont order onion rings or fries next time.

Thursdays they got a special: Philly Cheese steak, fries, soda for $10. Not bad, you save $1.50. Wished I came on Thurs instead. I will definitely be back again!
author: Daniel S.

description:
Phillies is a solid option for cheesesteaks in the city. Admittedly, I still haven't found "the one" just yet but I'll make my stay here while I search further. The plus for me in the convenience, it's right up the block from my house on the way to BART. 

 The cheesesteaks are large, filling, and they typically throw on any extra's for free if you pay for one (Mushroom Steak, Pepper Steak, etc). The bread is where a sandwich can be made or broken, there's is somewhere in the middle. Orders are quick and they also have the authentic Tastykake's from Philadelphia. When in Rome, eat a hardly edible (possibly decade old) pastry. 

Phillies then Jake's Steaks then Buster's
author: Daniel K.

description:
I wrote a review back in 2009 but it's not there anymore...

Anyway, I ate here back in '09 when it first opened. I was living in the neighborhood at the time and I instantly hooked. I had to have been going here at least once a week. I would pass by this place everyday and my mouth would water! I started telling everyone about this place like a crazy person; kept saying, "Dudes, you have to try this place!!"

I'll never forget that first cheesesteak! What an experience! It tasted so good!

And then I'll never forget my second cheesesteak. I got it with BBQ sauce wit whiz! That's how I got it from then on.

I haven't been to SF in almost a year in a half, last time was Dec. 2011, and that was the last time I enjoyed the goodness!


They seem to be doing quite well, which makes me happy! Mo, the owner, is such a nice guy, always made friendly conversation, and served it up well!


Thanks for the good memories, Mo. Hopefully I can make a trip back this year!

-Jon
author: João M.

description: This is my favorite Italian Hoagie since moving from the East Coast! I've tried a bunch around SF.
author: Dan L.

description:
I was just out in Philly for a wedding and part of our trip consisted of a grand tour of every solid philly cheesesteak spot given to us by a total enthusiast. What I found is that a proper cheese steak has the tasty and squishy bun, really juicy meat and cheese wiz. Of course you can jazz it up with some other ingredients but if you want a classic, there it is.

My husband and I were looking for a spot near our house to get a quick bit pretty late night. In the Excelsior this can be a challenge. We remembered about Phillies just opening up and decided to give it a try.

Holy Shit! This place is legit. Perfect buns that they get straight from the city of Brotherly Love. Amazingly juicy meat that they do not go stingy on. The Wiz and some slammin' peppers. They don't stop there. The fries were fresh and cooked perfectly. Next time I am going to splurge on some onion rings and some of the other sides because they were looking really good.

A couple other points about this place is that they kept the menu limited to what they are good at- Cheesesteaks with a solid assortment of your classic sides. This place is also IMMACULATELY clean.

Even if it is out of the way, this place is a must go. You will be addicted.
author: L A.

description:
I tried this place for a midweek dinner with my wife and while it was a decent sandwich and a good value, it wasn't "outstanding". Phillies offers a solid product but it's not "awe inspiring" -- even with mushrooms and cheese whiz. After all, it's still a cheesesteak.

The guys working there were pretty friendly as well so I have no complaints there. The obvious place to compare it to is Phat Philly in the Mission. IIRC, the cheesesteaks @ Phat Philly are pricier but the meat seemed more flavorful there.
 
* Parking is easier at Phillies than Phat Philly.

* I liked the rolls at Phillies -- they were crunchy and the grease didn't melt it's way through the roll immediately. I probably wouldn't recommend this for take-out though (or any cheesesteak for takeout -- for that matter).

* The fries were OK but nothing special.

* As mentioned above, I believe Phillies has a better priced sandwich.

* This place is good enough that I'm willing to go back and try the Zucchini bread (fried zucchini) and chicken cheeseteak. Would I put it on our regular restraurant rotation? That's still TBD. After all, there are SO MANY places to eat in SF....

Q: Would I grab a bite here if I was in the neighborhood? 
A: Sure. 

Q: Is it a place that is delicious enough to drag a bunch of friends across town to eat at?
A: Not really.

However, unless we are really, really craving cheesesteaks, I'm not sure ANY cheesesteak is worth driving across town to eat. Perhaps I'm just not that into them.
author: Gunn S.

description:
Amoroso rolls are imported from Philly, toasted on both sides.  Provolone slapped onto sizzling meat and peppers, then flipped into the roll...my first bite was crunchy, chewy, doughy and juicy.  My father chose pepper steak w/ bell peppers, onions, peppers and whiz...his eyes bugged outta his head!  He loved it!  Repeatedly told them hed be back.  Me being the huge sandwich girl, i engulfed mine.  Father not to be outdone finished as well.  Who decided to put a cheesesteak place on the cusp of daly city and SF?  Genius!

1 star for cold greasy fries...they did fry em again, but  was heartbroken by then.  Fries are my weakness and I'm sure they'll be what takes me down!
author: D C.

description: Recently moved out to cow palace area. lucky me, theres a bomb cheesesteak spot not too far. let me start off by saying, any cheesesteak joint that has cheese whiz gets an automatic 5 stars. not to mention, they use the staple amoroso's rolls that any awesome cheesesteak spot in the city uses. lotsa meat and decently priced! game time
author: Alvin P.

description:
Whoa! 

Phillies beats out Phat Philly any day!  Better quality meat, flavor, and huge portions on a massive Amoroso roll.  

They serve the whiz, as in cheese whiz, but you can also get it with provolone.  The mushroom cheese steak is fantastic and in addition to onion, it comes with hot and sweet peppers if you like 'em.  

From the street, look for the bright orange awning; the friendly guys on the inside will serve you up a slice of Philly heaven.
author: Colleen C.

description: Overall a great place to get an authentic Philly cheez. Compared to other cheese steak restaurants in the region the are quite affordable. I tend to like to supe up my Philly cheese with bacon, lettuce, tomatoes and even mushrooms. In comparison with other place where my bill would be any where from $15-$20 a meal my bill was only $13. What a deal! I highly recommend this joint.
author: Carlos G.

description:
Thanks to GroupOn for helping us discover another great deal!  

Small little shop, immaculately clean, helpful guy behind counter.  Roll was PACKED with meat, onions carmelized & sweet, peppers plentiful, mushrooms added a nice contrast to everything else and cheese?  We're not 'Whiz' people but the provolone did the trick.  An order of fries is plenty for 2 people.  They were crispy and delish.

The guy behind the counter was friendly and did the cooking to order with a flair for details that was entertaining to watch.
author: Lxs S.

description:
BEST CHEESTEAKS IN THE CITY! I've tried many places (like The Cheesteak Shop, Buffalo Burgers, etc) and Phillies has the best cheesesteak by far. It's small and in the most random spot and might be hard to catch, but you must find this treasure. I literally work right across the street from The Cheesesteak Shop and have been going there for years, but started getting fed up with the weak chopped up dry meat with barely any cheese, that they were providing. Not to mention the inside of that place smells like a hobo hotel.

Seeing as Phillies is right in my hood I decided to give it a shot. Man, why did I wait so long?!?!?! Delicious!! The bf and I agree that this place is LEGIT when it comes to our cheesesteak fix. We love our meaty sandwiches, and Phillies does not dissapoint. The cheesesteak was supplied with lots of thick meats, cheese, and TONS of green and red peppers. MmmMMMm. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. The onion rings were also huge and crispy - not soggy at all even when we took our food home.

If you like meat, try Phillies. It's meat-tastic.
author: Tay R.

description:
When it comes to cheese steaks there are 2 things I look for, One: THE TASTE and 2: HOW MUCH MEAT THEY GIVE YOU and this place passes.  
   I just happened to stumble across this place on yelp and saw all the great reviews. but I think eventually I would have found this place on my own since my parents live a few blocks away.

  Anyways, I've been to Philadelphia and yes you haven't had a real cheese steak until you have one from there; But Phillies is right up there.
 I'm so happy finally there is a place I can say its worth the money and calories.
 So the hardest decision is as always cheez whiz or provolone?
My suggestion is bring someone along and buy one of each so you can split and share.
 Sharing is caring!
author: Ness C.

description:
I've never met a philly cheesesteak in SF like this before!  Packed full of meat cooked right, a toasty bun, and the right amount of cheese (cheese whiz is my new favorite) to flavor up the sandwich.  The guy at the counter (MO) was very helpful in my decision of choosing cheese whiz, even though I was a little skeptical at first.  I've now been there 4 times out a 2 week span and the consistency of the food is dead on.  Thanks a lot Phillies keep rockin' n rollin'. 

W. A.
author: warren a.

description:
I will go back for another philly! I really enjoyed my philly that was cooked fresh while I waited.  The meat is cut thin and cooked perfectly and the bread is delicious.  
It's a small shop so there isn't much seating and the neighborhood is a little gritty.
author: Cheryl M.

description:
This place rocks.  You get a lot of meat and the taste is mouth drooling.  My fav is the steak n mushroom with provolone cheese.
This joint is very clean and has super friendly staff.

If you are a Philly Cheesesteak fan and you happen to be in S.F, you should check this spot.
author: Majed Q.

description: I just ate 10 inches of meaty gooey goodness! (thats what she said) cheese steak consisted of a mountain range of mushrooms nested in a velvety bed of provolone. topped with hot and sweet cherry peppers lusciously drizzled with warm cheese wiz. I didn't hold back and took it all in. Currently in a haze. Meat sweats, Fuzzy eyes, Orgasms, Anyone?
author: Terence B.

description: Very great tasting philly cheesesteaks, both original cheese and cheese whiz.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I wanted to go to broken record, but since it was a Friday and a nice weather, hubby and i knew that it was gonna busy.  I came across this place on Yelp and decided to try this.  
It's a pretty small place, but it can fit about 4-5 very small groups.  Went in to a bright place and it was clean, I like that.  
Warning:  Don't come here looking cute, coz you'll end up smelling like cheesesteak and maybe smothered with sauce when you come out.  
I got mushroom cheeseteak with whiz, onion and yellow peppers.  Hubby got the hoagie steak, whiz, onions, and yellow peppers.  We both shared the fries.  
Warning again: extremely hot it might burn your tongue and very juicy you will need lots of napkins.  
Cheese steak was goood and tasty! It's not salty yet very flavorful.  Don't take this to go or it'll end up soggy or if you take it to go, eat it right away! 
Fries are ok, this place is all about steak not fries.  
Oh yea, $6.75 for a big cheese steak?  Yup not bad!  My hubby said he'll bring his friends here.
author: Claire J.

description: I was in the mood for a Philly cheese steak and this place happen to be nearby. The place is pretty small but it's cozy. I got the Works and chili cheese tots and they were both pretty good. The Work was full-filling by itself, I would recommend sharing the side order of tots. Service was friendly and very welcoming.
author: Chris T.

description:
Alright *cracking knuckles and neck* first and foremost, I want to say that I really miss Starvin' Marvin's! But once I noticed this place, I was like alright, what the hell. It was a thursday afternoon, I stepped in, readily greeted took a look at the menu and almost everything on there sounded appetizing. Of course the Mushroom Cheesesteak called to me, so I got that with some fries and a drink...

When I got it I was like "DAAAYMN" never been much of a cheesteak buff or anything but it looked great! Stuffed with steaky goodness along with the peppers, grilled onions, and of course the mushrooms baby!! 

All in all, I was a good sandwich. The establishment has been greatly revamped inside compared to Starvin' Marvin's, really clean, the people are hella friendly. 

This all sounds like a 5 star status review right? Certainly does!!! 

BUT! The only thing that kinda threw me off was the lacking in cheese in my sandwich AND the steak itself lacked a little seasoning nothing hella major. Thats just me though, I have really sensitive taste buds. Perhaps throw on a little more salt and pepper into the mix and a little more cheese. Which I highly recommend, add more cheese for $.50, it'll definitely be worth it!

Anyways, I still love the cheesesteak though, very good job! I'd definitely recomend everyone to try this place!
author: Jesús P.

description:
All in all a good steak. It leans more to the East Coast style steak than Jay's (sourdough? lettuce and tomato?), but isn't quite as greasy or dirty as the real deal.

The folks working here are friendly, too, and took the time to make a good sandwich for me.

I'll be back for more.
author: Mason C.

description:
This place is awesome! I think it's been here for only 6.5 months, and I'm hoping they'll stay! It's great to not have to travel so far to get a good cheesy steak sub, though the parking can be a little tough. 

Its a pretty small, clean place, good customer service. Their steak subs are yum-mo! I got the steak with mushroom w/ buffalo sauce, hubby got the peppersteak. The bread was good, not too soft to be doughy. And with the buffalo sauce, forget it, there's no way to eat it like a lady...have those napkins ready!

Definitely will come back and try some of their other creations. There's even a breakfast one!!
author: Ly T.

description: Simple menu. Ordered a Rocky Balboa, and it felt like he was in ma belly round 430 am.  He must have been pounding me from the inside, gave me the squirts yo. Not diarrhea, the squirts. My lady was not feelin her mushroom Philly, so she didn't eat it and went to burger king, lol. Don't get the pizza fries, I'd prefer ketchup over the sauce they use. She said she will never, I might fux wit em again. The rocky balboa was a good size, needed more cheese tho, plenty meat. I like to live on the edge.
author: Julio z.

description: These guys don't mess around.  Simple menu and just one size fits all.  None of this "extra meat" charge of the chessesteak shop.  They proudly state "1/2 pound of meat on every sandwich" which seemed legit.  Nice fresh authentic rolls and toasted.  Perfect ration of bread to meat to provolone.  Good onions.  I bit swamped at 11:30 because the cashier was out doing some errand, but I will forgive.  Very fair price, which I expect is partly due to the fact that it's far removed from the high rent districts.  Not too convenient, but worth an excursion or as a lunch stop before your Daly City target run.  Also, like that they have a vegetarian sandwich and state how they cook it on a separate grill.  At the ultimate place of meat, this is a nice touch, even though I would never get a veggie item.
author: Marc S.

description: My office orders cheesesteaks from here every once in a while.  Today our cheesesteaks tasted different.  The steak was tough & it was missing cheese.  I called & spoke to the person who said he cooked the cheesesteaks & he claimed he did put cheese.  All 3 of our sandwiches did not have cheese which was what I told him but he argued with me and said I would have to proof it by bringing the sandwiches back to show him. I said it was ridiculous & he said I was ridiculous for accusing him of not adding cheese.  What kind of business would argue with their customers when indeed all 3 of our sandwiches didn't have cheese and we all agreed the meat was tough and dry?  What shocked me was his attitude.  Guess he'll be losing our business and our company's business as well because we will never order from them again.  After telling him I was disappointed with his attitude, he said he didn't care.  Wow!!! I'm still in shock by his rude attitude.  Too bad for them.
author: Mimi C.

description:
Why there is not a line out the door to this place just escapes me.  I visited Phillies for my first time last week and have already been back for my second visit since then.  I've been used to going over to Divisadero to the Cheese Steak Shop or Jay's where for long time I couldn't decide which one I would proclaim as my favorite cheese steak place.  Now Phillies has wild-carded itself into my heart.  Jay's who?  Cheese Steak Shop huh?

During my first visit, I had the steak hoagie, no mayo, provolone and peppers; delish!  On my second visit, I came in on a Thursday and had the $10 special meal combo with a cheesesteak sandwich with the whiz, fries and root beer.  I can honestly say that Phillies has some of the best fries in town; so get the combo if you've got the appetite.  

So what sets this place apart from the other?  I've gotta say, hands down, THE MEAT.  Its so moist and juicy, never overcooked and the juices run into the soft bread roll.  Drool.  The guys behind the counter gave us great service too.  The dude brought our sandwiches to our table which was a pleasant surprise considering its a fast-food joint .  The other thing worth mentioning is the cleanliness of the place.  Its sparkling.

Phillies is one of those places where you question whether or not they put crack in the food.  Its delicious and highly addictive.
author: Bonnie L.

description:
parking never seems to be a problem though it looks like it should be.

the sandwich price went up a bit to 7 something.  Though its still cheaper than some other places i've been to.  SO two thumbs up for that.

The sandwiches are filled with meat on the special bread ordered straight from philly itself, amoroso bread i think is the name.  its fresh and tastes great.

This is my GO TO place for getting a good Philly Cheesesteak.  I've had others but this ranks top for me right now.  Price, Size, Taste, Selection.  Its just better and easier to come here.

Also, I just wanted to share this on facebook also.
author: Bing D.

description: I have passed by this place so many times, on my way to school and back. Not knowing if it was any good or not, I never gave it a try. Until one day, I searched yelp looking for some help and I decided to try this place after reading a few reviews. I got the the buffalo steak, because I like spicy food and it was really good. The roll was soft and the steak was just tender and juicy. I will definitely come again
author: Nelson G.

description:
Phat Philly set a new standard for cheesesteaks in SF. Things take time to float down to the big E, and so like hipsters, cheesesteaks wit Wiz and on Amoroso rolls have come to Mission & Geneva. The result is pretty darn good.

I had a pepper steak to go here the other night and it was darn good - SPICY peppers, some expertly cooked steak and soft, grilled onions. Almost as good as Phat. Phat really finely chops their steak like Pat's style while the steak here is more coarsely chopped like Geno's. Like both they've got the Amoroso rolls here and some peanut chews for sale too. No Utz and Herr's potato chips and no Tastykakes, which is too bad. I'm not even from Philly and I love me some Tastykakes.

If I could have one suggestion it would be to squeeze the wiz into the bun before the goodies on a to go order, since 3/4ths of my wiz ended up on the wrapper and not in my sandwich. Damn good cheesesteak though, and really damn good for the price.
author: Flynn H.

description: Right near my apt so that's good. Their chili cheese tots are delicious! The philly cheesesteaks are also delish. So much so that my husband orders from here about 2x a week. They have the Rocky Balboa philly, extra meat, extra cheese that is my hubby's favorite. Plus the staff is super friendly and customer service oriented. Love it here!
author: Maya B.

description: The service was cool, the workers were really chill and kick back. Had a TV playing the raider game. 3-0 seriously?  Lol anyways the food was delicious I wished they gave you fries with the cheese steak instead of ordering it separately. Overall the spot is awesome and I will definitely be coming back.
author: Marvin C.

description:
I'm really glad that there's a philly cheese steak place in the neighborhood as another option.  Loved the fact that their menu was online and customers can call in for orders.

As far as sandwich eating options in the neighborhood, the better option for me is a coin toss between Roxie's Deli or Irving Cafe.  If I'm craving for a better philly cheese steak sandwich I'd rather go to Phat Philly and Thrill of the Grill in the mission.
author: Don B.

description: So while it pains me that I won't  be visiting this spot for a while (not hip friendly food) it's my go to cheese steak place. I get the mushroom steak sandwich...mmmm I can taste it now. Cheesy, meaty deliciousness with grilled onions and hot peppers on a soft bun with just enough bite. I like the battered mushrooms with some ranch to make it a truly gluttonous feast. The owner is super nice which is a bonus.
author: Hannah K.

description: Was in  the neighborhood and hankering for something to satisfy my belly...  This place offers Philly Cheesesteaks with the classic Cheez Whiz, American, or Provolone, sweet or hot peppers.  I got one with provolone and hot peppers on one side (I split one hoagie with my son).  Quick, super friendly service, and tasty!
author: Lawrence L.

description: LOVE IT!!!!! I'm always picky about my phillies and I must say this place did not disappoint!!!!! There's no fat on the meat which is my biggest turnoffs and not greasy!! The bread isn't soggy but has the right amount of juice in it. This is my new spot! So much better than cheese steak shop!!!!
author: Lizzie V.

description: just came from there. It's a local place that knows cheesesteaks. Good folks. Good on the atmosphere, especially if you're from Philly. Even sells tastykakes. Friendly, neighborhood place. Comfortable. Clean. TV. Good quick service and a variety of beers on tap. It takes me home again without trying to complicate something as basic as a cheesesteak and fries. Good chat with patrons and owner. Can usually find a parking space.
author: Martin Z.

description: Very good phili cheesesteak! The meat here is shredded perfectly and the bread is soft, long and soaks up the meat juices nicely. Cheesesteaks here are huge so be prepare to eat. Nothing super special but definitely one of the better classic phili cheesesteak places in the city.
author: Patrick L.

description: bro, they've got deep fried tater tots, so basically they've already won my heart. and the phillies aren't so bad either!
author: Regina C.

description: Mushroom steak with provolone cheese and sweet peppers.  Onion rings. Tastykake.  Don't bother me!
author: Bernadette G.

description: Great place if you are looking for a quick to-go order. Certainly not compatible with a sit-in orientation.
author: Abu Z.

description: love this place!  its a little small inside but its right around the corner from my house and being from the east coast its a little taste of home.  they also have tasty cakes!  yum yum yum!  only one suggestion, get some UTZ chips!
author: Skindy B.

description: I got 50% Phillies from www.bargaincrowd.com you can too its a free check it out its under more deals. The cheese steak was No joke one of the best i had had. For sure its the best you can find in San Francisco. Thursdays they has a special worth checking out. I know cheese wiz sounds funny but tastes so good try it and let me know what you thnk ;)
author: Sean V.

description: A solid west coast version of an east coast classic. Prefer they wouldn't have toasted the roll and would request that next time around.
author: David B.

description: Ok, that was damn tasty.  Quick, delicious, cheap.  What more do you want?
author: Julie T.

description:
I went there for the first time several weeks ago. The people at the counter were friendly and helpful. They asked me what I wanted and I asked what the recommended. They said the cheesesteak with chees whiz, but they had healthier options if I preferred. I decided to just go for it, and get the cheesesteak with cheese whiz and some fries.

The shop is small, but clean and new. They have a TV playing which is nice if you're eating alone. There are tables and counter space for dining. I waited about 10 minutes and they brought out my food to me. It was very good. Plenty of meat and cheese.
author: Matt B.

description: Just ok. Need more meat in the cheesesteaks, and thinner meat slices. Liked the Sprekher root beer, pleasant employees, & cleanliness of the place!
author: C O.

description: This is just plain awesome. Philly cheesesteak sandwiches made fresh in front of you. Small hole in the walls are always best. Had a mushroom philly which was recommended by yelp and the girl at the counter. Have out with wiz, onions, and peppers. Delish!
author: Adam L.

description:
Phillies brings the brotherly love to the Excelsior and I couldn't be happier about it!  

I was pretty bummed when Starvin' Marvin closed, because that was my go-to hangover joint, but Phillies has more than satisfied that deficit!  With delicious Amoroso rolls (I could just eat one of those by itself), thoughtful vegetarian options, super-clean surroundings, awesomely nice staff who are always kind and willing to serve me up my weird special orders without even batting an eyelash, delicious fries and rings, a punch card towards a free sandwich, and ... omg- Peanut Chews, they aim to please.  We've turned on some friends to their sandwiches and they claim that they are the best philly cheese steaks they've ever had.  They don't even live in this neighborhood and they go back like 4 times more often than we do!  My husband says that the vegetarian sandwich made with portobellos tastes just like the real thing, only better.  We just found out that they now serve tater tots... looks like I'll be going back sooner than later for that!  They take cards too, which is appreciated.  

Phillies has been a very welcome addition to the neighborhood, and I hope they're here to stay.  I like to eat there even when I'm not hungover.
author: Melanie S.

description:
Went here yesterday, main reason my blood sugar was low and I needed food.  I got the Mushroom Steak with cheese and my company got the Mushroom Steak, with Cheese, Onions and Peppers. I have to say I have no complaints about it. The young Man taking the order (and cooking) was such a pleasure to talk to---and patient (very important). My company said the only problem he had is it could have used lots more cheese. 

I'll go back and to try their Breakfast sandwich. 

They also have a "Thursday ONLY Special" (all day) that I didn't know about until I opened up their website (just now): Cheesesteak+Fries or Rings+ Soda = $10.00
author: Naomi H.

description:
It's the real thing. I love the wit american and onions, though wit whiz and onions is great too! I love that they have the sweet and hot peppers--man, going to Phillies is like going back to Philly.

Oh and the TOTS! Don't forget the magical TOTS! Super crispy, bite size, potato delights! They're great with the whiz.

This place is comparable to Tony Luke's in South Philly and Chinks' in northeast Philly.
author: alex t.

description: i have always thought san francisco didn't have a solid cheesesteak until i phillies proved me wrong , The best i ve had in the city ,  i think that explains everything
author: NAEL K.

description: This is as good as it gets to real philly cheesesteaks! They use real Whiz here! Bread is toasted perfectly to a delicious steaks.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
The people who work there are incredible, funny, and considerate.

Fantastic Phillies 

Gotta get an order of fries too! It just makes sense. Trust me.
author: Bentley T.

description: Total greasy comfort food, but so DELICIOUS. Don't forget to get a side, the onion rings are bomb.
author: Renee T.

description: Philly cheesesteak with whiz and hot/sweet pepper. -was good. I hated the bee that kept bugging me when I was eating.
author: Alyssa Z.

description: Quite possibly the best cheese steak sandwich I've ever had! The shop is clean. I always see the workers sweeping and cleaning the establishment. The staff is friendly and helpful. The owner takes pride in his business and it shows!  The cheesesteaks come in a variety of  types most importantly you get to choose between chicken or steak and theres even a vegetarian cheesesteak, all sandwiches come with your choice of cheese, grilled onions, and hot or sweet peppers. They also have the best french fries or tater tots if you prefer. Tots FTW!
author: Thomas C.

description: Okay so on a rainy Sunday I decided to use a zipcar and go back after all. I'm kinda too cheap to let the coupon go to waste.  I had the combo (hot peppers, grilled onions, grilled peppers, mushrooms and whiz) and it was pretty darn tasty. I would say it's on par with Phat Philly. The cheese fries were so-so.
author: Nikke G.

description: What a find!  It's a great little place in my part of town.  The people working there are really friendly.  They claim that there is 1/2 pound of beef in the sandwich, and I believe it.  The bread is soft, the meat is juicy.  Meatlovers rejoice!
author: Funk G.

description: I visit my parents regularly in the neighborhood and was curious to find a cheese steak shop in the area. What a pleasant surprise.  I've been to Jay's, Buster's, and the Cheese Steak Shop. All are pretty decent cheesesteaks, but I like Phillies the best so far.  It's only been one experience, so I'll have to check it out again for consistency, but so far so good.  I had the cheesteak with provolone, grilled onions, and peppers.  The steak was well seasoned and yummy!
author: A R.

description: I've eaten here 2 times so far and it's the closest true philly cheesesteak i've head since i was in Philly 7 years ago...its just so tasty and tender when you bite into it. i got the mushroom cheesesteak both times. i have yet to try the Cheesesteak Shop, but i love coming to Phillies cuz its so darn close to my house. yet another place i need to visit after my radiation treatments are over!
author: Justin C.

description: Solid cheesesteak and Mo, the owner, is cool.
author: Tim A.

description: After yelping for a quick bite in the neighborhood, I found Phillies based on the reviews. There was no disappointment. I found a cheese-steak so close to home and it was great. Prices were very good and the sandwich is filling. Will definitely go here again real soon.
author: Ram R.

description: I'm glad I stopped in and tried the Philly Steak Sandwich here. The bread was awesome, toasted on both sides. The flavor of the meat, with peppers, onions, and seasoning, delicious! I didn't try the fries, or cheese whiz, but I'll definitely be back!
author: Eric D.

description: Quick service friendly staff and definitely a good cheese steak. Plenty of meat. I liked the peppers and onions they added good flavor. my only complaint would be there wasn't enough cheese so make sure to ask for extra if you go with the cheese wiz. I will definitely be comming back as this place is only a short walk from my house. Cheese steak and fries came out to 9 something so not bad.
author: jeremy l.

description:
Hey! Not so bad.

Had a Whiz wit. Though not as packed with meat as some of the photos here, still really tasty. The bread was kinda awesome, too. One bite took me back to eating steaks at Primo's in Jersey as a kid. Funny how tastes and smells can transport you through time and space.

Nice that Philly Flyers colors are the same as the SF Giants.
author: Justin B.

description: This place is new to the area and I must say I am glad. I have been there twice in the last week and must say they do a good. Keep it up PHILLIES!!!!
author: Manuel D.

description: This place is always good.  Its not exactly the biggest cheesesteak you will find but it gets the job done.  They use the right ingredients and are always friendly. It's nice that it's in the southern end of the city.
author: Gary M.

description:
As i walk in front of the building, there is a guy outside on the phone yelling. I'm thinking it must be one of the disturbed people on Geneva ave. When I walk in the building I notice it's very clean but no one inside, incl the employees. As I turn around the guy on the phone IS the employee, lol!  While on his cell phone he takes my order & my money. As I wait for my change, a rude fat kid walks into the building and bumps right into me. I watch as he goes to the soda fountain to fill his cup, WTF!? Employee says nothing, neither does the kid. He walks right out w/ soda in hand & rest assure he bumps
me on the way out. employee cooks the sandwich & it took awhile (I'm the only customer). He continues talking and gives no notice the sandwhich is done, however, I notice the to-go bag near the counter. I get it myself and leave the building. Great cudt service- not! As for the sandwhich, meat was over cooked & crispy. Cheese only to one side. Too much mayo. I've had much better service and phillys elsewhere. This place is here to make a buck as the avg Philly is over $7. Keep in mind these guys arnt cheese steak experts!
author: Cee B.

description: Stumbled upon this place before a Bulls hockey game. What a find!! Having lived on the east coast most of my life in and around the Philly area I can honestly say this place is the real deal and would rival some of the best cheesesteak places back east. Great quality, fresh products and friendly service!! It will be my goto spot before all Bulls games.
author: chris h.

description: My family and I stopped through this place and gave it a try since the next nearest cheese steak spot from this neighborhood is near downtown. It was later in the evening when we stopped in and were'nt expecting much but when they served our meals  we saw steam coming for the basket smelling deliciously ...lots of meat just amount of onions and bell peppers wth peppers on top. We were impress to say the least i would recommend this place for any CHEESE STEAK LOVERS!!!
author: Emilio J.

description: I was excited about a new cheesesteak spot in my hood. Excited until I tried this sorry excuse for a cheesesteak.  Under seasoned/over priced is how I would best describe this "cheesesteak".   The meat had zero flavor and there was way too much of it.  I would rather see the sandwich a buck cheaper with a smaller quantity of nasty meat.  Plus it's called a cheesesteak, you shouldn't be charged 50 cents extra for cheese!  I say go to Jay's cheesesteak if you're craving cheesesteak.  Avoid this place!
author: schmoo l.

description: Ask for extra cheese. These cheesesteaks are not cheesy enough, almost non-existent. Overall it was just ok.
author: San X.

description:
Quite simply the best cheesesteak in San Francisco.

I prefer it over Phat Philly... there, I said it.

Go for the mushroom cheesesteak and get crazy with the cheesewiz.

My only complaint is that the onion rings were way too oily.

Regardless, both my wife and I agree that these cheesesteaks are phenomenal.

Take a trip out to the Excelsior district, and you'll be rewarded.
author: Dimitri S.

description: we always pass by this place since its local in my neighborhood but i never had the chance to give this place a shot until today. my friend wanted to give it a try so we did, order a regular and split it... not bad at all but i have a craving for popeyes since it was tuesday.
author: JessePanda C.

description: This place is such a find! Who thought you could get the same east coast taste right here in SF! After getting my order I thought they made a mistake and gave me double the meat but NO! thats just how generous they are! Never was a fan of the cheese whiz until now. Make sure you get it WIT the onions and WIT the whiz! TO DIE FOR! Will ruin my diet every week just to get a taste of this stuff :)
author: Delilah M.

description: Went here yesterday before going to the 49ers game and this place is great. The best philly cheesesteak I've ever had was a Pat's King of Steak in Philadelphia, and this one is about the only other one I've had that even comes close (esp. in CA). I got  the steak & mushroom wit onions and whiz plus hot/sweet peppes, and highly recommend it. An authentic cheesesteak is served with cheese wiz as the cheese and this is by far the way to go, and unforturnately in CA virtually nobody serves them this way.  I wish they would open a Phillies in the East Bay!
author: John G.

description: Thursday special is pretty good. Footlong mushroom steak + drink + fries = a little over $10. Although, I wish it was a little bit more flavorful. Still good, but I guess I was just expecting a little bit more.
author: Joel J.

description: I tried this place out a few weeks ago and it was meh. I ordered the regular old cheesesteak with provolone and no peppers. They specifically asked me 3 times if I wanted peppers or not and I declined. I got my order home and it was dripping with peppers! It's not that big of a deal, because I can pick them off, but, if you are going to ask me, listen to my response! The meat was not really seasoned too much and ended up applying salt and pepper liberally to my sandwich. It wasn't very cheesy at all, which I found odd. I couldn't actually taste any cheese in it at all. I also was fighting a cold, so maybe a stuffed nose is to blame. The fries were tasty and the service was friendly enough. They take credit card, which is a plus for me. That being said, an just-okay cheesesteak where I couldn't taste the cheese but could taste all the peppers I said I didn't want, fries and a soda set me back 11 bucks and change. Maybe I'll go back and give them a day in court, but, I'm not sure.
author: Jessica R.

description: The mushroom cheesesteak was DA BOMB. It was the perfect balance of meat and veggie. Food was prepared quickly, and the guy behind the counter seemed very nice. Can't wait to go back!
author: Jessica Q.

description: Twas good.  Imported rolls makes it as authentic as you can get out here.
author: samantha D.

description: big. fat. bomb ass philly cheesesteaks. my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Eric C.

description: it is fuckin BOMBBBBBBB. the guy who rung me up was really nice and they really serve sum GREATTTTTTT philly cheesesteaks. the cheese and bread just and the meat all just come together, i'm gettin REALLY hungry rite now thinking about it. Also, their breaded mushrooms and zucchini are OUT OF THIS WORLDDDDD. I can't believe there is finally a cheesesteak place by my house, now i jsut wish he made garlic fries and we would be SET!
author: Hubert L.

description: Definitely, a pleasant surprise for me and my wife as we were just walking past their store on the way to the pizza joint.  Friendly service and there's a grand opening promotion right now.  The sandwiches are tasty and the meat is plentiful.  Been there twice and bought 12 sandwiches so far, so it got to be good.
author: Al P.

description: The bread is excellent, and their regular sandwiches have the same amount of meat as the "king of philly" from the cheese-steak place on Divis, and taste just as good if not better. The guys in there are very friendly and know how to make a god sandwich. Definitely glad this place opened up a block from my house, and glad that its not another pizza place (there are literally four pizza places within 2 blocks of me). Nice to finally have something take the place of old Starvin' Marvin's. I'll definitely be returning regularly.
author: Toby F.

description: NEVER eat at this place dirty and disgusting, ive eaten here before food is pretty good but the last time i went i noticed the cook outside on his cell phone smoking a cigarette with his disposable gloves on he went back in the restaurant took off his gloves went back outside on his cell so i still went in ordered my food and when he came in reused his contaminated gloves and proceeded to make my food when i questioned him about the glove he confirmed he reused his glove i then demanded a refund NEVER eat here im almost certain he is also the OWNER
author: medina j.

description: the philly cheesesteak with mushrooms and extra onions and cheese wiz is awesome. But sitting on the high chairs made me full hellla quick. Overall this place is legit tho. Prolly visit it again
author: Blessed Z.

description: came here after work around 9pm. bought the veggie that came with portobello mushrooms. this thing was the sloppiest juiciest sandwich i've ever eaten, i even ended up licking the foil that the sandwich was wrapped in. The price could be a little lower for a sandwich that has no meat in it, but hard to complain.
author: Tim C.
